text: Excellent! Very fresh and delicious. It's a hole in the wall but don't let that scare you from getting it out.

First time tried a Poke restaurant which is so popular recently. I had a Medium poke bowl. Portion was great. All staffs are super friendly, food was amazing. Very clean, neat and cute restaurant. Definitely will try again!

I love the poke bowls. I even got my girl hooked on it too and she doesn't even like the raw fish proteins, but she makes her own bowl with spicy crab and mix-ins. We've been on a Poké Pokú kick and have been eating there for lunch all this week! We love it

My husband and I frequent this place and we have never had a bad experience here.  The people are always friendly, the building is always clean and the portion sizes are very generous!  Even our daughter enjoys the food. 

I recommend their Las Vegas style and soft shelled-crab.
My go-to place for poke bowls. I'm always craving poke poku. Great service and high quality food

Best Poke bowl place in Las Vegas hands down!  Fresh protein, great abundant selections for sides, and their Poke Poku sauce is the bomb!  Serving size is huge and they are generous with the sides.  Friendly service and restaurant is always clean.  If you love poke bowls, then thy this place out.

Hands down best Poke spot in Vegas
Fresh, flavorful, and filling
They even have a variety of complimentary iced herb teas you can choose from which I though was really neat. Can't wait to go back!

Hopefully owner pays attention to this review...

We came on Friday around 8:30pm. When ordering the girl informed us that they close at 9pm and asked if we're taking it to go to which I said no... we're dining in. While we were eating the food (which was OK but nothing special in a world of poke bowls) they started vigorously cleaning the store and putting the chairs up. Made us feel "very welcome"... like "can you hurry up and get out since we want to close now" welcome. By 8:52pm the sign was off and store was closed. In my opinion... if your hours are till 9pm - you serve till 9pm. Otherwise there is a whole bunch of other places to choose from where we are not rushed out of the door because staff looks like they are late for a Friday night party.

The food was great, well priced, and staff was friendly. 
Place is a little small so I'd recommend going when it's not too busy. Plenty of parking in the area, also try the crab meat OMG I died it was freaking amazing !!!
This is my absolute favorite place to get Poke ! They also have an amazing lunch deal from $5- 7 . I've tried A lot of places and they are the best !! Fast and friendly too
Best poke I've had in this area. Awesome place for a quick, fresh meal. Service was great, Will be back again soon.

This place is not a run-of-the-mill poke place.  They put great care and attention into each ingredient.  The sashimi is fresh and melts in your mouth.  The seaweed salad is fresh and crunchy.  The tamago tastes sweet and moist, of highest quality.  There's many more toppings you will find only here like crunchy onion, tobiko, mango, pineapple, etc.

I have come twice already and plan to come back many more times.  This place is a little more expensive than the other poke places, but I'd rather save my money and eat once in a while at a place like this than eating at the other typical poke places.

Highly recommend if you're coming from out of town.  I was surprised to find this place in the middle of Spring Valley, such a random place to stumble over great poke!
Great poke bowls. Very fresh ahi and lots of toppings choices as well as a dozen different sauce options. A lot of free toppings and good prices. Mmmmmm
Still long wait. Every single time I come here. No sense of urgency from the ladies behind the counter.

Excellent!  Free herbal teas!  Great service.  This was our first time and the staff guided us through all the choices.  Food was stellar.  The only downside is that there are MANY choices to make for each poke bowl. It takes a long time to put it all together. The line runs slowly.  You may be waiting even if there are only a few people there.

This place is OK, I went there for the lunch special which include sushi burrito, miso soup, "healthy water" and gyoza +$1.50. When i started ordering the lady who's making my food said that miso soup and water only if you dine in, but if you check the huge sign they have outside it doesn't say dine in only. So she went and checked with the manager she said yes it's only for dine in she end up charging me for the burrito and the gyoza. What I wanna say is that they have false advertisement, they couldn't even honor it. On the other hand my boyfriend was ordering his food and he asked for shoyu soy sauce and the lady said that they don't have it. Which poke place don't have shoyu soy sauce!!!!!! I will never go back!!!!!!

Create your own poke bowl or salad. Tons of add-ons and sides. Everything tastes fresh. Good price for what you get. If you like poke and/or want something healthy for a change when eating out, then go here. You won't be disappointed.

I just happen to see the store name as I was driving down rainbow Blvd and decided to give it a try. I have to say that the staff was very friendly and helpful. If you've never had poke or poke bowls before they'll guide you through the mix and match type system ala sandwich shops. Now down to the good stuff, the poke was definitely fresh  with a mix of some ahi tuna, salmon, spicy tuna, and the sauce mix I chose was their signature poke paku which had a little kick in it (just how I like it). I wouldn't say it's the absolute best poke I've had, but it's definitely a great, clean environment, with good staff. It also helps that I got a free macaroon ice cream sandwich for buying a large bowl, (not sure if it's a current promotion). I will definitely be coming back again soon.

I like this poke bar. Food is Fresh and healty. The toppings are unlimited which is a great bonus. They are very friendly and clean. I just dont get why this one girl only wears one glow when she handles your food. All the other workers wear 2 glowes on both hands as they are suppose to, this one girl who always happens to serve me only wears 1 glove on her right hand only and it happened 3x now. 
And I dont see her wearing the glove when I walk in it seems like she already has one on all the time. Which makes me little uncomfortable since she is touching my food with her hands and I dont know what her hands has touched before she touches my food. Since its raw fish I think they should put on their gloves infront of the customers and not have them on already while waiting for the next customer. Dont know if they use the same glove for so many customers or if they change them with each customer. 
Just something I am very picky about it is hygiene. Since its dealing with food and health. Taking one star of for the wearing one glove only issue. Other than that no other complaints.
My favorite place (so far) to have decent to go food little bit pricy though. Don't forget to check in! You will get a discount and there is a stamp card that will give you one free order.

This place is AMAZING! Was craving Poke and did some research. 

The girl that helped me was super nice. Will eat here again before I leave Vegas.

Ordered delivery, and it was at my house in under 35 min!

Very fresh proteins, big portions (I ordered the medium size and still had leftovers)
Their calamari appetizer was delicious too.

I would definitely recommend and visit again!

Delicious, big bowls of sushi and a variety of flavorful toppings, including Kizami nori! Try their fresh assortment of drinks such as their complimentary burdock root iced tea. I can't wait until they start serving the Tornado Potato which is a tasty fried potato swirl that I've recently tried in Korea. :3

My favorite place to go whenever poke comes to my mind for Vegas. Customer service is always friendly. When dining in, miso soup is offered. During weekday lunch hours, they would have specials. You also get complimentary self-served teas to choose from.
Very friendly staff.  Fast service.   Tastes great.  And bonus 10% off by checking in
I was there  few days ago with friends we had tuna and salmon was so good and services nice too.  I would recommend
My first time to have a poke bar...the staff was helpful.  The food is excellent. ..the place is clean. Will highly recommend.  Will surely come back again!

This is the best poke place I've been to! I've tried a few in SoCal and another one in Vegas. They have a great selection of fish, toppings, and sides. My favorite fish: albacore, red snapper, yellowtail, and salmon. It also comes with a free miso soup when you dine in. Wish they had one in SoCal bc I would keep coming. Definitely recommend if you're in/from Vegas!
Just finished a poki bowl and I'm really impressed. This place definitely is a must try. Mix the Korean hot sauce with the Gucci sauce and its money! Healthy and filling... I will be back!

Typically use the EAT24 app to order and I always do the burrito combo with a drink and dessert and I have the option to get the tornado potato. Then when I go to pick up the food, they never have the potato so I have to resort to their brick hard macarons. Food is good, but their service and customer service is

With so many new poke places opening up, this one is by far my favorite. The workers were super friendly and made me feel appreciated as a customer. I came in during a busy time but they put in effort to serve all the customers in a timely manner. I ordered a small bowl and it was super filling. The sauces are so addicting haha. I've already eaten here many times and still end up going back to try their sauces. Not only is the food delicious but they give free miso soup (with organic tofu inside) when you dine in! The miso soup is the perfect touch to all the infused flavors. I also love their complementary teas. And don't even get me started on their macaroon icecream mmmm

Really good poke. They have many sauce mix and i want to try them all. This place has good customer service and friendly atmosphere. I will definitely go back again and will tell friends about this poke place.
I love this place... worth every $$$ in my book. The people preparing my food are always nice and smiling.

What is just now starting to sweep the East Coast is a firmly established presence on the West to my total delight - and POKE POKU exemplifies what it means to be a solid Poke/Sushi Burrito joint.

POKE POKU is located in a strip mall with ample parking. Not too busy with seating for dine-in (if you dine-in you can also have their complimentary teas and a miso soup). I opted for quick take-out of two medium Poke Bowls. THANK YOU for having octopus and scallops as protein options! Everything was fresh and oh-so-yummy. A great variety of sauces, toppings, sides, etc. that is sure to please any poke fans. A medium was more than enough and was under $13. They also offer some desserts such as macaron ice cream or fish ice cream (ice cream served in a fish-shaped fluffy pastry).

Great place. Ability to order via Yelp a plus. Will totally return.

I like to see roll better. 
I came here before for the first time just to try.
I ordered a medium bowl and it was more expensive than to see roll. 
The lady that mixed my bowl seemed new and didn't know what she was doing. 
I told her not spicy, and when i told her to put the best sauce, she put the spicy sauce on my bowl. I didn't come back after that.

I come here regularly since I've been trying to eat more fish. The ordering style is similar to chipotle's. You start at one end, and order step by step. Starting with either a salad or bowl option (with several sizing options). Next you choose your sides. They have many options to chose from; Spicy crab meat, regular crab meat, avocado, edamame, etc..Next up you get to pick your fish. They have so many fish options including yellowtail, ahi, and octopus. The fish is always fresh and plentiful. Then you chose your sauce, and toppings. There are free teas you can drink and the music they play is awesome.

Don't forget to use their punch card for frequent purchases.

If you love sushi, you'll love this place! So unbelievably good and always fresh. My only complaint is how long it takes to order but I know people don't know how to order so that takes up time. Don't let that stop you from trying this place though. It's definitely worth it and that's why I keep going back.

I have always loved poke, and lately I have been craving it. Too bad Poke Poku is so far from my house, because otherwise I would be visiting this place twice a week. And even at that rate, it would take years to sample all the available permutations.

Poke Poku is set up like Subway or Chipotle, where you stand behind the glass and tell the server what you would like out of an assortment of ingredients. My husband and I both ordered medium bowls, which gave us each three scoops of protein. I had yellowtail, tuna, and salmon; and he had two scoops of tuna and a scoop of snapper. Next up comes two sides (seaweed salad [yum!] for both of us, with spicy crab for me and edamame for him). Then you choose your "mix-ins" (fruits and vegetables [cucumber, mango, onion, etc.]) and "toppings" (salts and spices [roasted garlic, ginger, tamago, etc.]). Last comes the sauce: I chose Hawaiian style (sesame oil, Sriracha, Aloha, and ponzu); and my husband had Japanese style (same as Hawaiian, but swap the Sriracha and Aloha with wasabi mayo). The server mixes these all in a bowl and serves them on your pre-ordered base. We both picked mixed greens, although you could also select rice (white, brown, or mixed) or baby kale (my first preference, although they were out of it when we were there).

As I said, there are thousands of possible combinations to try, but we were both pretty pleased with our choices. The fish was fresh, and the portions were plentiful. I just wish I could have tried the kale.

It's not fancy, but it's filling--and reasonably priced for freshly prepared fish (around $25 for two). So if you're in the mood for some island-style eats, pop on in to Poke Poku!

Im wow'd at this poke place. Great service and great food. They have a very good selection on each addition, base, protein, mixings and sauce. I like the softshell crab mux, its perfect for the bowl. Clean and comfortable dine in. Cant say enough, its a must to check out!

My wife shared the video of a promo that Poke Poku was having for one day only for $5 for a sushi burrito. 

And being from the islands and loving sushi, I couldn't pass this up to try it out.

So many different types of toppings, sauces, combinations. 

my wife got white rice with fried shrimp tempura, spicy ahi, cucumber, avacado, and the Poke Poku sauce.

I got white rice with Spicy crab, soft shelled crab, avacado, masago, white onions and the Poke Poku sauce.

both were DELICIOUS!!! 

they have a lunch special from 11am - 2pm I believe. sushi burrito with miso soup (dine in only) & water for $6. 

When you get the chance, go check them out

Really Really Really impressed with this place!!! This was my first time getting a poke bowl and the guy that helped me knew it. He walked me through the entire process. Fantastic customer service! Will definitely recommend and be back! Keep up the awesome work guys!

Worst freaking service. Took forever just to place order and when I finally did the guy rushed through my order so fast that it was so sloppy not to mention he didn't get it right. Will never recommend to anyone
First time here!!! I will give five+ stars if I could.  Nice and friendly staffs, fresh foods, and cute interior!! Definitely my new favorite Hawaiian Poke place!!!!

Came here for the first time on the way home-ish after some appointments on the SW side. My friend had just came here earlier on the day and told our "group" (fb chat) about the lunch special. Sushi Burrito with miso soup (dine in only) for $5, their house-made teas (dine in only - varies per day), and 3 gyoza ($1.50 extra)

-----------------------

Their original menu is as follows

Step 0 - Poke Bowl/Poke Salad - Small $9.50 (2 scoops), Medium $11.50 (3 scoops), Large $13.50 (4 scoops). Hawaiian poke - 5 oz $8.00, 10 oz $14.00. Poke burrito - 1 scoop $7.50, 2 scoop $9.00. 

Sides - Shrimp Shumai $5.00 (6 pieces), Gyoza $5.00 (6 pieces), Takoyaki $4.00 (6 pieces)

Step 1 - Base - White rice, brown rice, half and half, mixed salad

Step 2 - Sides (Choose 2 - Extra side +$1.50) - Seaweed salad, edamame, crab meat, spicy crab meat, avocado, fried shrimp tempura

Step 3 - Protein (Extra Protein +$1.75) - Tuna, salmon, yellowtail, scallop, snapper, spicy tuna, soft shell crab, shrimp, octopus, seared albacore

Step 4 - Mix Ins - Masago, red onion, white onion, cucumber, cilantro, pineapple, mango, organic tofu, tomato

Step 5 - Toppings (Unlimited) - Green onion, jalapeno, crispy onion, roasted garlic, tamago, kizami nori, bonito, sea salt, ginger, corn, tobiko, wasabi, shichimi

Mix in Sauces - (lots of styles, essentially a mix of different sauces) but they include Sesame oil, spicy mayo, spicy chili, sriracha, aloha, ponzu, shichimi, eel, yuzu ponzo, mango, guzzi, Korean spicy chili, wasabi mayo. 

-----------------------

I had opt'ed for the lunch special and I was not completely hungry and I tend to not eat that much for the "first meal" of the day. My sushi burrito consisted of a seaweed wrap which had white rice added by a machine with a sprinkle of furikake. For some reason, I opted to have seaweed salad and spicy crab meat. They pile the sides on before getting a metal mixing bowl for your protein, mix in items, and sauces. As a salmon lover, I definitely went for salmon and added red onion, cucumber. Wasn't too familiar with the sauces but I opt'ed to try their "signature" poke poku style which consisted a mix of sesame oil, spicy mayo, spicy chili, sriracha, and aloha. Not sure what aloha is. Lol 

What I didn't realize is for burritos, you cant get toppings cuz (for obvious reasons) you cant really put toppings on a burrito. Lol.. DANG IT (next time im getting a bowl LOL) They wrap it up and cut in half. If you dine in with the lunch special, they give you a small bowl of miso soup, and "access" to the house-made teas (but to be honest, cups are right next to it, I think anyone can get to it) 

The ingredients they use are pretty good. My only complaint is too much sauce is used in the mix. Next time I may opted out or just pick a specific sauce or two to use. Made it quite messy to eat and sauce filled. Would like a more "natural" taste. Sauce seemed to cover a lot. 

SIDE NOTE: one some of the side tables, they have Samsung QI's wireless charging pads for people to charge their phones while enjoying their meal.

In the past year, I have eaten at a lot of these "poke" places - this is by far my new favorite.  It feels authentic and amazing quality. Also, a staff that cares!  Ingredients were all super fresh. Oh, and they walk you thru each step.  It seems over whelming, but they hold your hand on each step! Unlike the place down the street that has a lot of choices and it don't matter, you don't get what you want. Oh, and the other place down the street that looks nice and clean, but has sanitary issues.  Speaking of which - ALL employees here had face masks on - AND 1 or 2 pairs of gloves on at all times when near food.

Added bonus - Samsung wireless charging at the table.

Oh - and 3 types of "water" or tea -  yummmmmmmmmmmmmmyyyy and healthy.

Lunch specials are great - even if you upgrade.

There are a lot of 5-star reviews for Poke Poku, so I'll let those folks convince you of this place's brilliance. For me it was a bit meh. If you've had poke at Fresh Catch in Honolulu, or the fish market at Hilo, or even Safeway in Lahina, you'll find the offerings here a bit confusing. It's like a buffet -- make your own poke on the spot. The ingredients are all fresh and good, but I think poke benefits from a bit of time sitting and blending the ingredients. 

The staff were completely clueless and the process is a bit arcane for a newcomer. There aren't any toro chips for the purists -- they serve the poke over rice or solo in a bowl.

Amazing LA style poke.

Their fish is fresh and cuts are big. Personally like that way because you get a taste of the seasoning + fish. Large has the best value. 4 scoops of protein.

Interior is trendy and clean. They also sell some UCC coffee. The line sometimes builds up but I'm sure they'll figure it out.

5/5

I moved here from Oahu and have tried many poke place n since I moved to rainbow. This is the to go poke place. Good portion fresh ingredient and I ll say it's actually really good in taste. Brought friends a couple times here n they all like it, my favorite is still Hawaiian sauce. Strongly recommend this for the price range. Just mind that there will be wait time during meal period.... n I will say the food line is not moving fast enough so be patient...

I have been pretty committed to Toosee Roll, but Poke Poku may be my new favorite. 

One reason is the mix of sauces you can have. I like that they have different styles already created. So far I've had the korean style, and today I had the Hawaiian style. But besides those two there are the Maui style, Kid style, LA style... just to name a few more. Something for every taste bud.

The ordering process is a bit overwhelming and a little tedious, but there are so many options for toppings. I guess that's not a bad thing to complain about in the big scheme of things.

Definitely worth checking out.
There bowl size is well proportioned. The seafood is fish. And you have lots of add ons to choose from. Not to mention the sauces u can add.
Great fish.  their Korean chili is so good. Next time we'll get their salad.. awesome healthy alternative and the toppings or endless!

Nice ambiance, attentive service, fresh ingredients and great flavor. What more could you ask for?

Would definitely recommend to friends and will be coming back again for sure. Thanks!!
Wonderful fabulous delicious what else can I say.  I LOVE healthy.  Excellent service.  Fast.  What more can you ask for.

I was pretty impressed by this place. I wasn't very hungry so i knew the small size bowl would be enough for me at that moment. The employee who helped me was so nice and accommodating. I wish i got her name! But she made my order absolutely perfect! Not too much rice with furikake. I requested tuna with NewYork Sauce along with scallop with spicy mayo for my protein. I appreciate that she was very diligent and precise. She even asked if i wanted it to be mixed in different bowls and if it would be ok if she used the same gloves. That i appreciated even though i did not mind at all. Shrimp tempura, and crab meat on the side. I also like that they give u small sheets of nori if you wanted to make a hand-roll. Mini miso soup for dine-in only! 

I had to knock off a star because a small was already $9.50 and it is small, of course additional add ons are $1.50 or so.. it does definitely add up.

I love sushi. I love good-quality Poké even more. Poké is from Hawaii, and I am SOOOOOOOOO glad it's now taking over the mainland. It's like sushi, but not little nigiri or rolls, but in a bowl, with lots of yummy other stuff!! You can tailor make your bowl, so if you're not a fan of things like imitation crab, mayonnaise or cream cheese - which you sometimes get as a "surprise" in a sushi roll, you don't have to endure that. So overall, I'm a happy camper. This place is relatively well-priced for a good meal - obviously a bit pricier than going to McDonalds, but... it's a trade-off between health and a slightly higher price point. Medical bills are definitely more expensive in the long run. Side note, did you know that only 4% of the population of Japan is overweight? Some of the main parts of the Japanese diet are fish and seaweed. Makes you think, huh?

We were hooked on poke during our last visit to the Big Island. We lunched today on the Hawaiian Bowl and it was the best since Kona--although we weren't used to all the decisions. The young man serving us was great and unhurried. Also picked some Takoyaki which were made on the spot.
He told us this was a California chain soon to have four outlets in LV.

Yummy food, not so great experience. Last night (Friday, Nov 24) I made an order via Yelp and it's actually tied to Eat24. After I paid for my order, it instructed me that it would take 40 minutes to pickup from the time it was confirmed (takes only 5min to assemble). Maybe they were busy at the time. Showed up at 40 minutes (8:20pm) to an empty restaurant with two young girls (employees) eating on a table at the side. I was quickly greeted and one of them went behind the counter to wait on me. Upon informing her I was there to pickup an order from Yelp, she panicked, went to the side to grab a piece of paper and whispered to the other girl that they forgot about this one. She came back to me and told me sorry, they had customers, they forgot all about it, and that it wouldn't take long. I said that it was fine and knew it wouldn't take long (which is why 40min was a little much of a wait). Just not very professional or responsible to forget an order. Lucky I wasn't in that much of a rush, which is why most people order online (so that it's ready for pickup when they arrive). Someone else may have even left a single star, even though the food is amazing. The 3 stars is for the food, and would have been 5 if this was an altogether smooth experience. Also, the reason they did not get a tip. You never know what will happen, so I tend to tip after I have all my info. No sense tipping on my card when they forgot about my entire order lol that's just not smart. Place was clean, as always. The manager just needs to hire people with more focus. I'll still go back, just won't order online again.

Nice, helpful, and very friendly staff at this establishment. The Poke bowl is also well deserving of 5 stars. Fresh ingredients and all kinds of different combinations of building your burrito or poke bowl. This is place where a Poke fanatic must stop by and try. To me it was my favorite from other Poke Bars in this area.

Poke poku is not my favorite sushi burrito spot but it isn't the worst! I like that they offer bowls! I prefer the bowls, they have multiple choices of protein to chose from and unlimited toppings and sauces. If you dine in you get free tea/water and miso soup! On weekdays they offer a lunch special $5 sushi burrito! I enjoyed their gyoza which is one of my favorite things on their menu. I think their bowls are a little over priced but their portions are decent.

Decided to give them a try. Their large bowl gets 4 proteins. Same with all poke bars, good variety of toppings. Most toppings are free. I love the fact they had sides- like my favorite fried shumai. They give a complimentary cup of miso soup for dining in. Atmosphere is more Japanese bar. Not sure where the "Hawaiian" came from aside from some decorative palm trees. Lots of Japanese or Korean music blasting. Staff was friendly just make sure they put their gloves on when serving you.

Another poke place in vegas. I dont know if I just ended up putting too many weird things in my bowl, but it was overwhelming in flavor. I do like that they have so many options to put in your bowl as well as sauces. Fish tasted fresh, but somewhat small portions. Customer service was excellent. Interior is cute and they have homemade teas. Hope to try again and make a better bowl
Great service and fresh food. The staff are really helpful as this was our first time eating here and they explained the menu and offered recommendations.

Very clean establishment, friendly staff, free wi-fi, free wall chargers and most importantly the food was awesome and also its healthy food, lots of options and the decor was also very nice. As for prices, its really affordable! Definitely will be coming back and recommending this place!

I love poke bowls! 

It's a great lunch option as the small bowl is the perfect amount of food for me and I truly enjoy the fun environment here. They play j-pop videos and I find myself always in a better mood by the time lunch is coming to an end.

So why the 3 stars? 2 reasons - 
They advertise fresh avocado and even show it in their own marketing images but what they really offer is mashed avocado only. I'm not a fan of mashed avocado in my poke bowls plus I strongly feel that you should sell what you advertise. And the second reason is that the bowls are more expensive than their competitors by $3-$5 and there's tons of competition out there.

Pros:
Complimentary miso soup (dine-in only)
Complimentary teas (a variety of fun flavors)
Fast & friendly service
Build your own business model
Lots of delicious toppings and sauces

AVOID! I had a salad poke bowl for dinner and got food poisoning the morning after. My body has never experienced food poisoning to this extent...lets just say I was pretty much a goner for two straight days. Never coming back here including their other locations. Don't want to risk experiencing this ordeal again :(

First time here - the BOGO happy hour from 2-5 brought me here. Buy one bowl/burrito whatever and get the second one free, for dine in only though which is fine. This place was very similar to many other poke places that are springing up in las vegas now. You have to pick your starter- white rice, brown, rice, salad, or mixed salad then you move on to your normal proteins and toppings. I was kind of sad they had run out of yellowtail already though (it was around 300?). They did just open so I think they are still trying to get everything right - I say this because they were really slow, but this is something I think they will get with time. The miso soup was a little salty. Oh! They have multiple desserts you can get like the potato twister! I wanted to try it but I had already gotten a medium size bowl with 3 proteins in it They have a multitude of sauces and one secret sauce that wasn't on the wall they provide called the GUCCI SAUCE. This shiz was good. I can't tell you what's in it because they would not tell me whatsoever..it's the secret sauce haha I also really liked the feel of this place - very Hawaii and made me feel really relaxed. One thing I distinctly remember is one of the waitresses/workers (?) walking around wiping tables with Christian Louboutin heels on LOL I give her props for working in this type of establishment with high heels lolol I will definitely be back to test this place out again.

This place was awesome. My wife and I shared the large bowl. Really fresh fish, great Rice, and lots of delicious toppings. If you aren't sure what to order then just ask the people at the counter what works well. This place is SUPER CLEAN! Definitely a huge selling point for me. We will be back without a doubt.

Came here because of the 5 star yelp rating (almost a rarity after a hundred reviews)... And 5 stars I giveth. They beat jaburrito and sweet poke in my book. Place is very cozy, worth dining in. Their miso soup is far better than some japanese restaurants... And free when you dine in. Their fish is very fresh and the sauces will sure delight your taste buds. 

Haven't tried the free tea but will surely do when my wife and I come back. I think they specialize on the bowls vs burritos but you won't be disappointed with either. The staff is more than helpful in recommending what to get. Keep it up guys!

Love this place. We live nearby so go regularly. Portion sizes are large, and everything always tastes very fresh and tasty. Also they never seem busy which is good (but maybe bad for them). Recommend to try this place out as a great alternative to your usual sushi spots.

I. Love. This. Place. Everyone that works here is so friendly T.T I used to hate poke bowls before coming here... LOOOOOOVE I JUST WISH IT WAS CLOSER.. A location in the Southern part of Vegas would be ideal... close to red rock casino or somethingggg

Great place for a poke bowl. Fun friendly staff,  island atmosphere, fresh ingredients. Alot of places are afraid of sauces...Not here and I am a sauce person. To top it of free miso soup and a sheet of seaweed. Great flavors and prices it's worth a try

Super friendly and helpful staff. Was our first time there and it was so so good!!! The medium poke bowl was more than enough! All the food was fresh and the complimentary teas were tasty!! We will be back!!

First time visit.  I was really impressed. Friendly & very clean atmosphere. I got a large bowl and was walked through the entire building process. Large portions and the fish and seafood looked and tasted very fresh.  I will definitely be back.  If you dine in you also get a free bowl of Miso soup:)

There are a ton of these poke bowl/burrito places that have popped up in the last year and after trying all of them I have to say this place is my favorite. Very fresh fish and ingredients and really tasty sauces. I usually do a bowl with the poke poku sauce. Looking forward to trying the other sauces. Only improvement I can think of is that the line at dinner time is slow.

Poke Poku is one of the better poke bowl options- despite marketing themselves as Hawaiian, they've got the standard build-as-you-go format. PP stands out by having more add-on and mix-in options with a traditional slant, like roasted garlic, furikake seasoning, dried seaweed, tomato, bonito, and pineapple. They also have a variety of traditional-sounding teas available at the drink station, though I admittedly didn't care for the ones I tried. 

Unlike most of the other poke bowl places, they have tofu and scallop as protein options. They get a bonus star for mixing the protein, veggies, and sauce by hand before putting them in the bowl. This seems obvious, but a lot of places just drizzle sauces on top or leave the bowl dry, and the marinated flavors are a big component of what i look for in a great poke bowl (americanized or otherwise). 

There's free miso soup with dine-in. It's free, yes, but it's also possibly the worst miso soup I've ever had, because it had a distinct dishwater taste to it that made me think, "no wonder it's free." Definitely an area to improve upon, but one that's easy to overlook when your seating options include a giant indoor beach umbrella to turn your lunch break into a mental mini-vacation!

Woah Ramen was such a good portion for about $5 or less. Their food is fresh, fast, and simple to order. They have a variety of teas to drink from. I love the atmosphere so simple and clean. Spicy ramen was spicy. Good lunch specials, good prices, and fresh food!
One of the best poke place in town. We live 35min away but we still go there to eat. That's how good this place is.

The bowl was amazing, but the service wasn't the greatest. While I was waiting to order. Something looked good that one of the girls was preparing and I asked what it was. She said it's a burrito? I don't know what you're talking about... of course I could see that it was a burrito, then I had to go into further details asking what ingredients she used. I feel like she could have used better verbiage and could have been more pleasant other than using a tone that made me feel stupid. I almost wanted to leave at that point, but decided to stay. Then a different girl helped me make my bowl. I told her it was my first time. She started off great asking if I wanted brown or white rice. Then she asked which side I'd like and let me taste the spicy crab. She didn't explain all the sides, I just assumed they were the ones that were open. Toward the middle of the process she asked what mix ins I'd like with my protein choice, and I asked if they had avocado. She said yes we do, but it's a side. I asked her where it was because I couldn't see it. She was like oh it's over here and it's covered.  You can get that next time you come, or if you want it now, it'll be an extra dollar. She never explained all the sides to me after I explained I was a first time customer. I asked if there was a way I could have the avocado instead and she picked the crab off and put the avocado on instead. After she switched out my side, she mixed my protein choice with mix ins and left without excusing herself. Then some guy ended up taking over my order. I just feel like the service felt a little off. Other than the service, again, the food tasted amazing. Prices I feel are a little high. I paid $11 for an extra small bowl.

Poke bars are a dime a dozen these days, but some much better than others . Poke Poku calls themselves a Hawaiian style poke bar, but I am not sure what is "Hawaiian" about it. I  think they are about the same as other places, with the exception of some fried appetizers and desserts.

What I liked:
- Complimentary teas available
- Free Miso soup when you dine in
- Free Wi-Fi
- Fruit toppings like pineapple and mango
- Lots of fun sauce combinations 
- Friendly workers 


What I didn't like 
- Avocado is offered as a side, but it's more like guacamole. I dont care for guacamole in my poke bowl and I'd rather have fresh avocado.
- The price is much more expensive than competitors. A large bowl, which is 4 scoops of protein, is $13.50.  
-The miso soup, although free, was only filled up a quarter of the way full and was pretty tasteless.

All in all, if I want to spend $15 on lunch, I will probably go elsewhere.

Place is really nice, hip and modern atmosphere. Walked in and was greeted by a big smile and welcoming attitude. Jayden was the gentleman that helped me out. Told him it was my first time. He kindly guided me through the menu and explained the steps on making a build your own. I got a med build your own poke bowl. $11 not bad 3 choices of seafood. Option of  white rice, brown, half and half, mixed salad, or baby kale. Than next you choose your side, protein, mix-ins, and toppings. Each order served with miso soup. They offer 3 delicious teas for free as well. Definitely worth every penny
This place has the best poke I've ever had! Great service, dope atmosphere inside, and good music. Food is top quality and healthy too! Definitely come here if you like Poke.

Asked for avocado to be added on my bowl. The lady told me they're making it and to wait. I saw two employees sitting in the corner eating (on break). They lady in the front could've got the avocado but instead she waited for the guy on break to come back to get them! So stupid !!!

So glad we ran into this place. Brand new I think; in the new plaza where the goodwill is. The fish is super fresh and they do not skimp you on portions. There's a lunch promo for $5 sushi burrito and $7 poke salad that comes with miso soup! Also complimentary tea!! Our total was a total of $12 and some change. UNHEARD OF. Seriously a STEAL. So many toppings and options. They also make a crab mix with real crab which was bomb with my salad. They have various sauces too with cute names. I tried the vegas style which was sesame oil, "Gucci" and ponzu. Lol they also have fresh marinated garlic as a topping which is BOMB that I don't see often in other poke places. Only downfall is there is no cream cheese which my boyfriend always requests with anything poke or sushi. Lol we literally killed both of our orders though. The small salad is a good portion. Next time I'm thinking on trying one of the bowls. The environment is clean and cute and have a cute little bench table for the kids too. Haha. def a must try for lunch at least. U can't beat the price.

So disappointed, especially because poke is not cheap...this is my go to spot for poke salad but today the fish was not fresh. Tasted extra fishy, took a couple of bites and couldn't bring myself to finish the rest of the tuna :( what a waste.

Really good! Nice selection of toppings and mixins, plus a huge variety of sauces. Great presentation as well. 
Fish was super fresh, seaweed was crispy. They even had tamago and bonito in the unlimited toppings section. These guys are really doing it right!

Complimentary miso and teas for sit down diners. 

I missed the themed preselected bowls of Too See roll down the road, but I think poke poku is a bit better overall. I'll certainly have this punch card closed out in no time!

Stopped by for a quick dinner on a Wednesday night.

The decor is fun and comfortable. The service is friendly and prompt. The menu is fairly easy to read and understand. 

The standout quality of this place is their variety of ingredients that you can have added to your bowl or salad. You really can load up on a ton of stuff.

Overall the food tasted very good and clean. I would return.

This place is amazing. From the fresh fish, extra ingredients, weird corn brewed tea. I'm glad we stumbled across this place trying to go to another "poke" spot. The staff was nice and walked us through the process and recommended things to us. We will most definitely be back.

Think of Subway but Poke. I went on opening weekend. Quantity of food was great but quality was poor. Everything was bland and lacked Flavor. We're out of many items. I'll pass next time. Their are better Poke options out there

Oh my God this place is good. I've been addicted to Poke for about 2 years and this is probably my favorite. Here's four reasons why Poke Poku is excellent:

1. You can get soft shell crab as an option.
2. If you want a small portion they have an extra small option.
3. Unlimited toppings
4. You can get yellowtail as an option.

Seriously the bowls are fresh and delicious.
I love this place! I go here almost every week . Me and my man love the large poke poku style bowl.now we are a vip!
Tried this place last night...food was amazing, service was excellent! A little pricy BUT they give a lot of food, well worth it! I'll definitely be returning soon
This place poke bowl is the best and then aloha sauce is the bom~~I gonna come back eat poke burrito soon~~
Delicious poke! Generous portions are provided. The korean style sauce is not too spicy for me but I eat spicy food often.

My whole family including myself love this place. It's so tasty, fresh and friendly service.
I love the full control of what you can have in your sushi burrito. The free Miso soup while you dine in and oooooh. The free teas they have as soon as you walk in with little boards explaining the benefits. Perfect having cold teas as soon as you walk in and wait in line. 
I've taken maybe 4 or 5 different friends here and they all agree. I've only had one bad experience, that they never told me they had stamp cards and I've already been there a dozen times. But that won't hurt your rating. For now, muahahaha. Jk :)

So been meaning to try Poke Poku out for sometime. I had feeling was not more of your traditional true 808 poke but more of the new trendy style of build your own bowl then pick your protein, sauce, and toppings. I truly have no problem with especially when your starving from a post long run and craving raw fish and rice. lol!!! Hawaiian they definitely have that theme down from the minute you walked into the restaurant. It got the island vibe the only thing missing is local hawaiian station. I appreciated that they were playing current music in the restaurant. 

It was my first time so went with the Poke large bowl/ I got three different proteins one spicy tuna, salmon, and albacore. My toppings tried not to go crazy. Nothing worst then overkill and takes away from the fish. True Poke never about the sauce but the fish quality. I feel the quality is good at Poke Poku. The sauce went with the LA sauce. It tasted basically like spicy tuna sauce you would get in sushi I felt. Good. The portion size feel like your not getting cheated at all for the money you pay. So many different toppings and options you really could go back everyday for week never get the exact same thing twice. They have nice options comes to beverages. They have refrigerator with different bottle and cans choose from and fresh made teas (three different ones). Not just Poke bowls I got order of gyoza. It was solid. The only thing odd was ask for gyoza sauce it doesn't come with one. They just started serving ramen noodles on the menu. 

The service was five stars. The gentlemen making my bowl went over the steps being my first time. Friendly, attentive, and made my first experience great one.
Fresh food, lots of options, delicious sauce, and great service. Love all the bonuses you get with dining in.

Oh my goodness, Poke Poku! I was so eager to try this poke out, that naturally I forgot to take a picture of my beautiful food. Next time I will for sure! I'm not a Poke expert by any means, but I believe this spot gave me the will to become one...I know, sounds cheesy lol. 

Seriously, everything was delicious! I tried a rice bowl with half and half white and brown rice with 3 scoops protein: yellowtail, salmon, and spicy tuna with the LA style sauce. For the sides/toppings I chose: spicy crab, seaweed salad, the sweet egg patty (forgot the name), roasted garlic, red onion, red and orange fish eggs, green onion, futikake, seaweed strips, tomato, mango, and probably some other stuff I can't recall. They have so many tasty options and everything is fresh and prepared right in front of you. I also ordered a Spicy Ramen and the steamed Dumplings which were both on special for $4.99! Both very hot and tasty as well :) I know it sounds like I really pigged out, but really, I DID! Although I shared my ramen and dumplings, I still could not manage to finish my medium bowl because they really do load it up. I had enough leftovers for a snack the following day, so that's always exciting! The food is absolutely excellent, the employees are friendly, the atmosphere has a positive vibe, it's clean, and they offer free Jasmin, barley, and corn tea. I can't wait to go back again!

UPDATE 06/09: Came in for late night dinner. I noticed that I didn't get a little stamp card the first time I came in, so I asked Ralph if they could stamp my new card for last time I went in and he was totally cool with it! Once you get 10 stamper-oos you get a medium poke bowl for $0!! Thanks for being so chill, Ralph! Awesome customer service! 

Also, I just noticed that they advertise coupons on the back of Smith's grocery receipts so be sure to keep an eye out!

This is by far my new favorite poke place in all of Vegas!!! The portions are amazing, the flavor of everything is just spot on. The place really brings a nice family atmosphere. Normally poke places I wouldn't make feel full or this satisfied. So happy I don't have to go back to islands or drive to Cali to get great Poke. The staff is great and it has a really great manager! Will try to come as much as often to eat poke.

My 3 year old and I dinned in last night and as usual  my poke bow was amazing! I've never had a bad experience with a bowl or salad. The downfall is that a few changes have been made and even though the price dropped the large bowl is 3 scoops of fish instead of the 4 it used to be. 

What continues to make me sad is that they don't offer any sauce with any of their fried items. I come here purposely because my kid likes the fried stuff but he also likes sauce and I don't know of anywhere else that serves calamari without a sauce. Odd. 

Lastly, while we were dining in the music wasn't the edited version. F bombs were blaring away. Luckily my kid didn't notice and the parents with a younger kid behind me didn't seem to notice either but eventually someone will make a big stink about this. 

I'll keep coming back but I'll be ordering to go and possibly won't be ordering the fried food

Solid poke spot. With so many of these places in Vegas I feel like this one wasn't anything to write home about. It's not terrible, but it's not mind blowing. The staff was very friendly. I didn't have the long wait that others have mentioned. The fish was reasonably fresh. Everything was just okay. The rice was okay. The fish was okay. The sauce was okay. (You can see where I'm going with this.) Where they did miss the mark is having the tornado potato advertised on tabletops and on the menu but not having it in stock. I was basically told not to hold my breath on it ever being available. But for $5 sushi burrito for lunch, I don't feel like I could complain.
So delicious! Very fresh and large portions. Highly recommend the poke salad when looking to eat healthy

Why is this not in Colorado!?!? Sigh... we're always behind on the trends awh well, let's get into it!

Food: 5.0 of 5.0
Service: 5.0 of 5.0 
Environment: 5.0 of 5.0

L.A. Style Poke Bowl

Fell in love with this place for many reasons. The serving sizes are incredibly generous for the price you pay. The variety is extensive and the food is flavorful and fresh! Zero complaints, added bonus is they employ friendly, helpful and attractive counter servers. :)

Glad to have another poke place down the street!  everything I had tasted so fresh: fish, toppings, & the white rice was just right  They make their miso soup homemade & their free waters on the side are healthy (jasmine, corn water, & burdock weed). Definitely coming back here again!

Great poke bowls with very friendly service. I've been there a bunch of times now and the ingredients are always fresh and flavorful. There's never really a line there although it does take a little bit for them to construct each bowl, so keep that in mind if you're in a hurry. I do wish they had cabbage as a base like some of the other poke places in town but no biggie. Highly recommend and I'm glad they're in my part of town!

My new favorite poke place!! 

Food is fresh and delicious!!
Friendly employees! 
Great prices. 

2 thumbs up! 

I won't be going anywhere else.

Amazing. I got the medium bowl with spicy tuna, softshell crab, and  seared albacore with tins of veggies and Hawaiian Sauce. I love sushi and poke places and have tried so many in town. Many are just average to be honest between Soulfish Poke and Tail Fin etc. Depends on the day you go how fresh the fish tastes and for spending  $10 base plus on bowls I was always annoyed the amount of upcharges and how stingy these places are with non existent basic portions whether protein or veggies. I don't eat out often but love healthy spots that are quality among give you value for your money. This place is it. I had never heard of Poke Poku until I was randomly in the AutoZone in this new plaza as I live in the SW. I have passed it so many times but just one of those places you don't see and have never heard it mentioned. The staff was polite and not trying to rush through my order as all too many places do among love all their food options and desserts. This has hands down become by go to Poke place and one of the handful of places like Skinny Fats and Greens/Proteins I will have in my arsenal for delicious but healthy options when I'm not cooking. Can't recommend it enough. I prefer this SW location as I live in mountains edge among it being a more spacious and little island getaway compared to their Eastern spot which I work near. Don't hesitate if not for the seared albacore and avocado included options alone Lol! A+++

I love this place they have lunch specials and when you dine in you get a miso soup.. although I feel that they never ask u of u want if you have to ask yourself... they also have different types on flavor water and teas for you to enjoy

I ordered a Medium bowl which is 2 scoops of protein. The protein servings are pretty hefty here which is great. Fish tasted fresh. Service was awesome. 

It is a little pricier compared to their competitors in the same area. The toppings are pretty limited to only a couple things and then you gotta pay $1 or something per extra topping. This is what makes it more expensive. For the same price, you can get unlimited toppings at the other Poké shops on the same block. 

Spicy Crab meat tasted too Mayonaisse-y.

I'd come back again for their fresh ahi.

Couldn't find any Sashimi so decided to try a Poke Salad on a whim.  Found this place and when I walked in Sat during lunch and saw a lot of people there, I figured it must be good. 

Ordered a medium salad to go with Tuna, Salmon, and Yellowtail with Poke Poke Style sauce.  The lady working there was very patient as I asked what all the names I didn't recognize were and I added a few of those to see what they taste like. 

I am wondering why in the world have I never tried this before!  It was awesome.  This will definitely be my go to spot on a regular basis now. 

Delicious!

Amazing! Love the atmosphere inside and the staff are lovely. Opening up all over Vegas! Great concept.

And the poke bowl was to die for!

My favorite Poke place in Vegas among the many poke spots that have popped up recently in Vegas. The fish is fresh and the workers are very informative. They even let you try out the sauces and combination sauces if you have any questions about them.  You essentially make your own bowl similar to Chipotle. First you choose your base-white rice, brown rice, greens, or half and half. Then you choose your sides, choice of protein, toppings, and sauce. There are preset combination sauces that have already been concocted for you. Feel free to ask the worker which sauce goes best with the items that you have chosen. The restaurant is decorated Hawaiian style with lei and umbrella decor with ample seating. There is even a small kiddie table for the kids to sit at! Three different kinds of complimentary tea is served. Definitely coming back here again and again!

What a great poke place! Our girls loved it so much that they said it's the best poke they ever tasted.  Needless to say, nothing was left on their plates (they took the medium sized bowls).  Thanks for a delicious meal :)

Cons- Sweet poke is better it needs more options. 
They have this vanilla ice cream sandwich that they advertised outside and i asked the lady for one and she looked so clueless, she said that they dont have that here and really made me look stupid. they also have a really small cup of miso soup for free,which is nice, but the quality of it makes it not worth getting.

Pros- the interior design is wonderful and i really enjoy the Hawaiian vibe they have going here! Even though the choices arent alot the bowl tasted really good and would totally recommend!

I ordered a large poke bowl and the amount of food I got was overwhelming. It was definitely worth every dollar spent. For the lack of business due to the cold weather, their food was very fresh and appealing. They offer a lot of well-liked and known items to go into your bowl which helped me make my decisions easier. I will definitely be back again to this location frequently! Oh, and they have a great staff/management too. Give this small business a chance and they will succeed.

Such a great experience. Best $5 lunch I've had in a very long time. I ordered the lunch special sushi burrito. Everything was fresh and flavorful and the portions were generous. Complimentary miso soup and iced tea comes with all dine-in meals. Such a great deal! The staff were so friendly. I sure hope they get enough business...I went at noon on a weekday and was the only one there.
I love the poke poku bowls and their green tea ice cream macaron. The staff is friendly and helpful.

There are several poke restaurants within 5 miles of this one so its easy to skip over, especially since its hidden in a not-so-busy plaza. I'm so glad I finally decided to try this one though because it is now my favorite! The setup is pretty much the same as other spots. You choose a bowl size or you can do a burrito. Then you choose some sides, some protein, and unlimited toppings. What I liked the most was the sauce selections. The portions are also very good. The small gets two large scoops of protein for about $10. 

Staff was super friendly and the hawaiian themed decor is very cute. My new favorite poke joint!

Just fantastic!!! I ordered a take out medium bowl and the ingredients were fresh, the choices were abundant and the sauces were plentiful! I ordered the Japanese style sauce and was not disappointed!!! Service is fabulous!!! The gentleman who took my order was originally from Korea and was super friendly! Was very much impressed with both food and service!!! Great job!!!

I was fortunate enough to win a free bowl on their Facebook page drawing so I took advantage of it. I ordered a poke bowl with crunchy tako on it along with 2 sushi burritos ; one being an ahi tuna and the other being of California roll variety. I will say that the bowl and the ahi sushi burrito was delicious and my gf who ordered the California Roll was hooked on it. The fish was very fresh and the mix in were perfect. And the sauces perfectly balanced the roll. The employees were very helpful with making my choices for each one. I definitely will be going here again while anticipating the northwest location. Thank you for food and excellent service. You won me over on my first visit

Poké poku is one of those places you go to try and then it becomes your go-to spot every time! This place is super cute, the staff are helpful and kind, and the food is AMAZING. Not only are the ingredients fresh and delicious, but the serving size is more than enough. The medium is enough for two meals (for me). They've got a variety of sauce combinations, protein choices, toppings, and so many fish eggs! There's also 3 or 4 complimentary teas for you to drink. I love it! I'm so glad we happened upon this. Check it out!

All these Poke places are becoming very ubiquitous...and that's fine by me! You can't go wrong with most of these places as it's very similar. Pick your carbs, pick your fish, pick your toppings...etc. Nothing we aren't already used to.

I've eaten here and its other locations on several occasions and never had a bad experience. I love the complimentary refreshments they have such as the barley, corn and jasmine(?) water. The service is always friendly and the girls working there are pretty cute (just saying :D).

Every location has a check-in deal via Facebook that saves you mula + a stamp card. You really get the bang for your buck. Dine in and you get free miso soup as well. They just love showering you with freebies and I'm not complaining man.

Lastly, the macaroon ice cream is my favorite. I've seen the same ice cream at several different restaurants and they seem to be slowly replacing mochi ice creams to be the next staple, cool treat. Love this place and the one on eastern/215, I'll be writing a separate review for that one as well.

Keep doing what you do PP, stay cool, don't change

Another poke place in Las Vegas! I wanted to go to one that allowed me to get as many toppings without surcharges. 

We came during weekend lunch and it wasn't busy, couldn't order the specials since it was only for weekday specials. 

The employees were nice and friendly. I got a poke bowl with half salad half brown rice! Topped it up with almost everything they offered. The fish were really fresh. The many different type of sauces gets really confusing. I just mixed like 5 together, and it tasted pretty good! 

The free brewed tea for eating in was really interesting! Could taste the infused barley, and corn. 

The poke bowl had so many flavours, so many toppings, I was like in heaven. Each bite was a new experience with different flavours depending on the toppings on my spoon. 

I wanted to come back the next day, but was flying out already :( 
Can't wait to come back! 

I forgot to use the yelp check in discount! Was too overwhelmed with excitement when I first went in!

So good!  I got a small bowl without any items from the "protein" menu aka seafood and was very satisfied. 

You might say, "Hello...it's a poke restaurant what are you doing there?" I have been on a plant based diet for a while (by choice).  It was exciting that there were still many options to choose from. 

My meal was fresh and just plain delicious.  The rice was cooked perfectly.  I love that a variety of brewed teas are also offered complimentary.  

Now I'm just hoping they will consider offering a discount for those who still want to enjoy this style of food prep without the seafood.

Believe it or not, after all the years of the poke bowl craze. I had my first poke bowl late last year. And I'm so sad I had it at Poke Poku because I was in town visiting family and my sister and in law wanted me to try out this place. 

Now, since then I've tried a few more poke places. And a good poke place are a few and far in between. That said, I have not come across any other place that compares to Poke Poku. 

I would say they are a little pricey. I had a medium with 3 scoops and the scoops weren't that big. But overall, once it was finished with toppings and etc, it was a heavy bowl. The reason why I never tried poke bowls it because I don't like eating rice really (I know, I'm Asian) so I don't like eating rice with any raw fish especially. However I did not mind it. And it's probably cheaper if I ate rice instead of trying to get full from poke, which is impossible! 

What I love about Poke Poku is their sauces and the many varieties they have. Their sauces are so darn tasty, I wanted to lick my bowl after I finished it. Many places have the simple spicy mayo, ponzu or shoyu but I'm a girl that craves for flavor. And they offer so many more different toppings (like literally!) compare to other poke places. I just love their variety. They have complimentary tea and miso soup for dining in. I make sure it's my first and last stop in Vegas.

Found this place on yelp with tons of great reviews and decided to check it out. Honestly wasn't to impressed with their poke bowls. They definitely do go above and beyond with toppings and options, however their fish is sub-par. Personally, that is the most important part of a Poké dish. 

Poké has become a big thing, and can be found everywhere now a days. Problem with that are places like these that don't give Poké the great name. Worst part is they still charge the same as the places that truly have the great fish and much better bowls.

With a ton of poke spots popping up around Vegas, I'd say Poke Poku falls a bit short. Its located on a busy busy street, but I didn't have a hard time with parking. Clean, with a lot of seating. I like how they have lunch specials like a poke burrito which I got for $6. Prices here are a bit higher than other places. I think a medium bowl with 3 scoops was around $11-12 which is the same price as a large bowl else where. While the fish looked fresh, they didn't have that many options for toppings. 

I got my salmon burrito to go. I liked how they have a machine that automatically makes a rice sheet with a push of a button! But... I did find hair in my rice. I also think they should have avocado slices so that the avocado mash doesn't make the burrito mushy. My fish was unevenly distributed so on one half of my burrito, there were only 3 pieces of salmon and the other half had the majority. The burrito is a bit smaller than other places as well... not sure if thats due to the lack of topping choices so I only chose cucumber, onions, crab meat and avocado with my salmon.

Its our first time in here and Im sure we will be coming back again!


I got size medium and you can get 3 scoops of protein for that. I got two scoops of salmon and one scoop of yellowtail. You can also get 2 shrimp tempura for your sides!!!

Free miso soup!!! (Dine in only)


Atmosphere is really chill. You can get these healthy water for free also. 

The girl that was working when we went is really friendly. In fact,  out of all the poke bowl places Ive been too shes the only one that smiles lol. Oh I dont know her name but she has a nice pink hair.
So far so good. Very friendly, everything looks good. Love this place. Food is fresh and workers are friendly!

This place was the bomb diggity! Hopefully they can expand to different locations. Service was fast and easy. They also have free wifi which really gives the place a nice vibe to eat in, played music which also made eating enjoyable, I would gladly eat there again anytime!

This place is the stuff. They hook it up and the misu soup. Yumm. Friendly staff. Food is worth what they charge and I always leave the place satisfied. I recommend to every one. Place is very clean and I'm always satisfied every time I go here.
Love this place! Always fresh and delicious and friendly and all around great! Free water cups and tea too!?!! I'm in! My belly is so happy :)

Best poke around!  It's really fresh and they have an excellent selection for sides.  They offer free miso soup, which is kind of bland.  They also offer free tea, which is delicious.  The roasted corn is my favorite!  Why 4 stars, especially when I love, love their poke?  The music.  Its SO LOUD.  When the manager is around, it's not bad, but when he's not, it's loud.  I've asked them to turn it down before, just to be told that they can't.

Went here with my co workers for their five dollar deal. If you have a Facebook I'd recommend following them so you can also not miss out on any offers! When we got in I believe the dinner rush had just started, so it took about twenty minutes to even order our burritos. The sushi business is certainly not a fast one! But the workers were very nice, albeit a bit tired looking. For the five dollar deal you're able to get a sushi burrito (1scp), mochi ice cream, miso soup, and "healthy water," which basically means the barley, corn, and jasmine teas at the corner of the store. Overall, taste was nice!! I got the miami style sauce, which I enjoyed with the salmon. We also got their takoyaki which wasn't bad either. Anyway, I would come again!
I really liked this place . It was honestly really reasonable and the ramen was amazing for 4.99 and big portion size sexrdp

The ramen is a joke. Broth is horribly watered down. You can't have good ramen if you don't have good broth. They shouldn't called it "ramen",. Just salty water with the cheapest noodle, enormous amount of onion and cold egg. Poke bowl is 5* but ramen is a joke. Under the table I saw cockroach. Not good experience this time..
My first time here today.  It was amazing!! I got the medium size poke bowl and it was delicious!! The employees were so nice!! I love the setting inside!! I'm definitely coming back soon!!
Love this place. Tasty and fresh food and very clean restaurant. Employees greet you with smile and help you with suggestions.

I've only been here once and I fell in love. This place has a great atmosphere and wonderful customer service. Their servings are huge for such a good price and it's delicious! Variety of selection as well. Definitely coming here for poke cravings!

I'm giving this place a 5 even though poke just isn't my thing. Everyone else (6 other people) loves their food the other day when we came in to grab food to go. I think I'm just not a fan of poke in general. I did like how you can completely customize your bowl and they have A LOT of options. The price is good too. I would come back here for sure if I ever needed poke for the family again.
Best poke I've had in Vegas. The food is high quality, the restaurant is very clean and the staff is helpful and friendly. They have a great selection of iced teas.
Excellent service and step by step guide to your meal. Portions are just right and freshness n flavors are spot on. A new favorite.
I liked this place a lot cause they had A LOT of additives you can put in your bowl.  but they were stingy with the fish. but overall the taste & portion is good and huge. thumbs up
Honestly the best poke place on the main land. The staff is super friendly and knowledgeable. The food is fresh and just stop reading this and go there already...worth every penny!!!

This place right off the bat id highly recommend. Portions are generous for what you pay for. The options a plenty and highly customizable the best part if you can't make up your mind you can try it or have it all, literally. Definitely worth trying them out. 

I personally got a poke bowl, they also have poke burrito which I will save for my next visit. 

Tip: Dine in to get the miso soup

By far my favorite stop to get a quick sushi burrito in my neighborhood. They have a really great deal from 11-4pm which is a $5 sushi burrito! It also comes with a miso soup if you dine in. What I really love about this place is that all the workers I have encountered are very nice! I just can't get enough of their burritos!!!

This is the best place! Poke spots have been showing up all around town but no one does it better then here! I have been going here for awhile now l and keep coming back. This place is nowhere near where I live but it's worth the drive about 40 mins for me. 

The fish is great. Everything is full of flavor. Staff are great. My usual order is a medium bowl with everything spicy all the way. Size of fish and other add-in conspired to other poke places is amazing. You get a free miso soup and they have some interesting complimentary teas to try. 

You always compare new places to the best out there and when I go to try a new poke place I have caught myself comparing it  right away to poke poku.

I do quite like this place. I've only gotten the sushi burritos from there, so I don't really know much about the rest of the menu. So when you go, expect loud music and cold chairs. That's probably the only things I would change. Oh wait, I forgot about the inconsistency of the sizes of the burritos too. I tend to get something similar each time, but the sizes can vary to "eh, I'm still a bit hungry" to "oh-ho-hooo this thing is so thicc (WITH TWO C'S) I don't think I can finish this!". 

The quality of the fish itself is pretty good. They tend to be cut in smaller pieces so you get a better ratio throughout. Something I want to try though is to ask them to mix the seaweed salad in with the bowl that they  mix the sauces, toppings, and fish in. I need to keep that in mind for next time I go. The amount of choices you get is pretty good as well. You have the option for brown or white rice, you can do a sushi cheeto burrito (hot or original, I recommend the original), and you have a nice spread of things you can toss in there as well. They do have tamago, but they won't stick it in the burrito. Completely understandable because you wouldn't be able to close it at all.

Something else I like about this place is their free water station. I remember a barley tea and a roasted corn water, but I'm pretty sure there are one or two more. I think it's a nice thing to add on since soda can be too heavy of a drink to go with the meals they provide. They have reasonable lunch specials and if you eat in you get free miso soup. I will never argue with free. Every once in a while they will have promotions they show on Facebook where they'll  include some dessert of some sort or another appetizer with the meal. It's pretty cool. I'm looking forward to their new location in the NW side of town!
This is my favorite poke place in Las Vegas! I have tried them all and I always go back here! They have the best selection of add on's and sauces! Give them a try, it will be worth it!

Surprising delicious Poke with a large selection of veggie/protein add-ins.  Ordering is simple (similar to chipotle/cava mezzo/chopt).  Again, lots of fresh options and added ingredients.  One stop poke bowls and salads.

This place is soooo yummy! I love all their Mix-ins and toppings. So many choices. Best poke place in Vegas. A little expensive but I guess that's the price to get such fresh tasting fish out to the desert!  thank god its kind of far from us to keep me from going too often!

I got their medium bowl which was more than enough for me. It comes with three scoops of protein so I got two scoops of tuna and one of salmon. I got it with brown rice, seaweed salad, and spicy crab. Also, put in a lot of toppings with it.

Although, I had a lot of ingredients put into it, I thought it was pretty bland. There wasn't really much flavor into anything even with the sauce mixed into it. I've had poké before and it was really good. There was something off about it that I couldn't pin point. 

I gave it four stars because it was priced well, healthy, and the service was great. I'm sure if I tried mixing in different ingredients, it would be much better than what I got.

I recommend this place.
This is now my new Poke hot spot. Love the selections and the price is very reasonable. Must check this place out people!!

It's been a while since I've been to a poke place, and I'm very glad I chose this one. I thought the prices were a little steep at first, but after I ordered my medium-sized bowl, I was totally wrong. This thing has filled me up for the entire day--I absolutely love all the choices we get as far as toppings and mix-ins go, as well as how HUGE these bowls actually are! I definitely want to come back, but the next time around I might opt for a small bowl and play around with some of the sauces they have to offer!
Came in last night and had a small bowl and it was fricken delicious. Starving after a long day at work the bowl hit the spot! I will definitely be back and fill up my stamp card!

Okay so this place gets better every time I try it . They have fixed everything I didn't like about the place at the beginning. I love that I can order just the Hawaiian poké by itself, no rice or salad.

This place is so good and easy if you are on the go! They have a lot of options for your custom poke bowls. They are very generous with their portions too. I got a medium and it came with a base, 3 scoops of protein, 2 sides, and unlimited mix ins and toppings. I could barely finish half of it. 

I would definitely come again whenever I'm in the neighborhood :)

I give this joint 3/5, I believe my experience could've been better. I don't normally eat meat bc I'm a pescatarian, so I am always eating seafood. I wanted to try some place new and it was my first time here. The poke itself was great, but $10 for a small bowl I didn't think it was worth it. Also, they didn't have any avocados and it was the only side that I was looking forward to getting.

Service on the other hand was alright. I didn't get a chance to catch their names, but this one Asian lady who was serving me toppings was very kind and welcoming. Although, the other worker who I assume is Caucasian wasn't so nice. I asked to sample one of their sauces, but without hesitation she rudely asked "Are you even getting anything.." I mean, I didn't just come to sample sauces. & I felt personally attacked because I am a big fan of poke, and seafood in general.

I'd like to come here again and hope my next experience won't be as bad as this one.

Rainbow Blvd in the southwest seems to have a poke place almost every block and Poke Poku is one of the first ones you'll come across when driving south of the 215. The concept is similar to others, with their Subway/Chipotle-style of customizing your order, as are their options. But, they do have items like soft shell crab, octopus, and scallops, which others do not. Also unique are their suggested combination of sauces like LA Style (sesame oil, spicy chili, aloha sauce, and sriracha), Korean Style (sesame oil, aloha sauce, Korean spicy chili), and Japanese Style (sesame oil, wasabi mayo, and ponzu).

Their medium bowl ($11.50) is slightly more expensive than other places, but my bowl consisting of brown rice, seaweed salad, crab meat, tuna, yellowtail, octopus, masago, red onion, cilantro, pineapple, crispy onion, roasted garlic, bonito, ginger, sesame oil, sriracha, ponzu, and aloha sauce was more than enough. The quality of their product was pretty good, but nothing stellar.

Complimentary beverages are available, too. Burdock root tea, roasted corn tea, and jasmine tea are all up for grabs. The roasted corn -- as strange as it sounds -- wasn't bad. It was basically like corn flavored water.

I've been to a couple poke places around town and this might be my new fave! The overall vibe and chill staff made my experience pretty enjoyable. They're hip with it. They even have takoyaki.

What did it for me was that they offer complimentary tea and miso soup. It's the little things. I love all the toppings and they have tamago! If you knew me, you know that I have this obsessive relationship with eggs.

I can't get over how cute this place is honestly. I can't think of any complaints from my visits and can't wait to come back.

I had an excellent meal
Here today.  They have 5 different steps from r the perfect poke bowl/salad/burrito.  You get a base, 2 sides, 2 proteins, 5 items to mix in and 12 different toppings.  On top of this culinary creation you get an option of 9 different sauces from around the world to further enhance your taste buds.  I used the Korean sauce using a spicy chili sauce called gochujang.  Apparently this restaurant started in Hawaii, opened up some in LA and now are opening up multiple locations here in vegas.  The gentleman behind the bar was extremely friendly and knowledgeable.  He made suggestions which turned out to be very helpful and crazy tasty. 
Will be back soon.  This is real Poke
Best poke on the Rainbow Poke Strip! Great variety of sides, protein, add ins, and sauces.

I really enjoy having this place next to my gym. Its always nice having a healthy food option close. The customer service is excellent and their food is very fresh. If you dine in you get a complimentary cup of miso and they also offer infused waters at no price. These little things show that they care about their customers and want them to have a good experience.

I had NO idea what I was doing as I'm not familiar with Poke. I like sushi, so thought, "ok...kinda similar...let's figure this out"  

Been here twice, and the folks behind the counter were amazingly patient and so friendly!! They answered my questions (and trust me...I had ALOT), and they provided a few recommendations (which I truly appreciate - because that's how I learn things I'm not familiar with). The Customer Service is spot freakin' on! 

The fish is fresh and flavorful, and there are many toppings to choose from. I particularly liked all the sauce options. Figure I'd start at the top and just go down the list.

Will be frequenting this place ALOT.
Great place to get a Poke Bowl or Salad. Great portion size! Customer service was great!

Ordered this as delivery which I think would definitely have been 5 stars because I like to see what I'm getting before and am not that family at with the menu. I ordered the sushi burrito. It's sounded interesting and new so I gave it a try. It's very much like a maki roll, which if that's your thing than go for it! But it's not my thing. Regardless the ingredients were all very fresh. The portion was huge! I couldn't even finish half if it. If I am to eat here again I'd  order a poke bowl instead. I'm familiar and like to choose my ingredients. Kinda pricey but worth the freshness.

Love the food and have been back a few times.    My biggest complaint is the customer service.   The first employee to acknowledge we were there came and stood in front of us without greeting us in any way.  No "hi", no smile. Just stood there.  She seemed very put out to have to do her job.  The second employee working the line seemed annoyed when I wanted my sauce on the side.  No smile or politeness from any of the 3 workers.  The owner needs to watch this.  I don't care how good the food is somewhere, if the employees annoy me I won't go back.  Business lost for them.
