One of my go-to's for lunch! Love getting the $7 poke salad or $5 sushi burrito. Both come with miso soup and AYCD flavored water (it's a thing) if you dine in. Each come with 1 scoop of protein and ate very filling so don't think it's never enough. I like trying different combos of proteins, mix-ins and toppings. Whatever you get, it's almost always going to be Instagrammable anyway so go crazy with your choices. Big fan of Hawaiian or Japanese style! Also, they have loyalty cards. Buy 9 get the 10th free! Great friendly and vibrant ambiance... Nice escape from confines of work.

This Poke Bowl spot does not disappoint!  I've been to many back in LA and this one is Super friendly, they have great bowls, lots of options for toppings, they even offer some complimentary iced teas.  

I have a food allergy and they were very nice and accommodating to craft a bowl for me.  I will definitely return

Absolutely awesome poke. Huge portion for only $11.50 and it comes with free miso soup if you dine in. They have an awesome toppings list! And the ability to get 2 free sides is huge. Free avocado?!?!Clean and the staff were welcoming and friendly.  This place is a winner for sure. Keep the positive reviews coming so they stay open!

I really like this place! The employees are nice over here. The food is delicious and truthfully I'm not that much of a seafood person. My favorite part is the sushi burrito lunch specials. Only $5! And most of the time I just eat half and save the rest for another meal later. The place is really clean and they even offer some free drinks. This place is by far my favorite poke bowl place!

So my wife and I was craving for poke, we forgot this little place was in the area. 

I ordered the tuna poke bowl with rice. It's a $9 bowl. You get your protein you choose how you want your tuna sauced (they have sauce styles on the wall) and you can pick your toppings right after. The best part is the tea they provide are complimentary! Anyway the tuna is good here, I get scared to order tuna at restaurants because some places put in the chewy muscle (there were none thank goodness) so I enjoyed my tuna bowl. 

I ordered a small bowl of rice for my son with 2 pieces of shrimp tempura. They were nice enough to accommodate my picky eating son.  Thank you! 

It was a great experience, with good music. When you play Porter Robinson, EXO and Madeon it makes your surroundings even better :) 

Our go to spot for poke

First time trying this place. Portions are HUGE. Very generous with an amazing amount of sides. They also offer shrimp tempura as a side which is a big plus. They offer soft shell crab as a protein as well which I don't see at other places. The sushi chef is very nice and helpful. He'll let you know the best things to try. It's a great atmosphere, and the restaurant is very clean. I wish I had found this place sooner because I live very close by. Definitely a hidden gem. Also they give free miso soup if you sit in! I feel like I under-payed for all the food I ate. Looking forward to coming back here again. Highly recommended for anyone that likes sushi/poke.

Coming from Hawaii, poke is one of my favorite foods to eat.  There were many that opened within 5 miles and I tried them all.  This one became my favorite - I've filed 2 punch cards already and have recommended it to many friends, neighbors, and anyone looking for poke in the SW area.  Fish are fresh, lots of topping options, and many seasoning combinations to choose from (and you can add different ones for free).  You can make a bowl, burrito or salad.  Staff is very friendly and helpful.  When they first opened, services was slower as staff was getting used to things. Over time, it has improved greatly.  They had many specials I was able to take advantage of - free miso soup when dining in, sometimes potstickers or mochi ice cream.  They offer freshly brewed teas for free. Pricing is reasonable and worth the amount they give.

Out of all the poke choices on Rainbow, I really believe that Poke Poku has the best options and portions for their price. Servers are friendly and there's plenty of seats. Not only do they serve poke bowls but like every other poke place you can turn it into a burrito or salad bowl. They have items like hot Cheetos burrito, ramen, takoyaki, gyoza..the list goes on. 

Now what I like to do when I order from here is order a Small bowl with rice then add extra protein. It's extra but who doesn't want more fish. Fish is pretty fresh from the looks and taste of it whenever I've gone in. They also have so many add-ons to choose from as well as pre-made sauces to go into your poke bowl/burrito/salad. 

They also offer a variety of teas to go with your meal. Free of charge! Corn tea was interesting. But I prefer the barley. 

It's located in the same plaza as Good Will and is next to the Dollar Tree. Don't forget to ask for your miso soup when you dine-in. Another plus is that they have punch cards :)

Big disappointment. The sauce was not well made. Bland and watery. She did not follow all the ingredients listed on the board. Since the sauce was watery, it drained to the bottom of the rice, leaving the salmon tasteless and dry. I feel like I am eating a raw and dry salmon. 

I informed the lady about it and all she can say was "sorry".
I asked for other sauce on the side and again she did not use all the listed ingredients on the board. She forgets to use the sriracha sauce, and omitted one other sauce. 
I just roll my eyes and throw my food away in the garbage. 
She needs to be fired as she is bringing this business down.

I've been here twice now due to the location being walking distance from Brew Tea Bar making it super convenient for me to get my boba fix after, haha.

Food: 
Both times I thought the food was just alright... not authentic Hawaiian by any means (the bf is from Hawaii so I've had my fair share of authentic poke), but if you're craving a poke bowl, this will suffice. They offer complimentary miso soup as well as teas (barley one is yum) with signs describing the benefits of each tea - pretty neat! 

Pricing:
A bit on the pricey side compared to ToSeeRoll which is close by on Rainbow.

Service:
What really threw me off the second time I went was the customer service. The girls behind the counter were chatting it up and dancing to the music while taking my friend and I's orders. There was only one other customer in front of us when we arrived, and both of them were helping this one customer while we weren't even acknowledged. By the time they got to us, they were still chatting with each other and we had to wait for them to finish talking before they asked us about the next topping. 

Overall:
After the experience from our second visit, I don't think we'll be going back. There's much more poke options in the city that are authentic and provide better service.

First time here and boy do they give a lot of toppings. 
I went for the lunch special $7 and you get miso soup and build your own salad and their house brew tea to drink. Tuna was fresh and delicious 
I would def come back

Great customer service, pretty good portions sizes, tons of choices (but they will walk you through each step) and great food with freshness you can taste! Very friendly. Wish they had one on the Northwest side of town!

I decided to come check out this new poke spot because I live close to it. The shop is very clean and nice. I didn't know what to get so I asked the staff there and they were very friendly and patient with me as well as giving me recommendations of what to choose. I chose a small bowl with 2 scoops of protein, mix ins, unlimited toppings, and mixed it with the LA Style sauce. The portion was a decent size and it filled me up. The poke was fresh and delicious. If you like poke, this is the place to be. I will definitely be back!

I came hungry and left extraordinarily full, which is not always an easy feat at a poke place. Usually when I go to poke places I get a large because for some reason I'm always still hungry. I got a medium here and couldn't even finish it.

Even though I've been through a good amount of poke places, the steps are very helpful. One huge plus here is that they mix everything together. Something different here is that they offer a spicy crab meat and also shrimp tempura. I really liked the spicy crab meat, it was a nice addition. They also have the option of pineapple and mango as toppings, which isn't offered everywhere. 

 I was really overwhelmed at the end trying to read all the sauce combos. I just didn't bother anymore and added whatever sauces tasted good in my mind. 

The poke bowls are a little more on the pricier sides, but worth it. I couldn't even finish everything.
Great fish, good sauce selection, high quality toppings, fresh and tremendous service. We will be back!

Hands down the best poke bar in Vegas! The staff is super friendly & the prices are reasonable. Can't beat the unlimited toppings & appetizer selections! My best friend and I come here almost every other week.

I just discovered this place and I'm addicted! I can proudly say that this place is better than sweet poke! If you come during lunch hours, sushi burritos are only $5 and it comes with miso soup! They have "healthy" waters which are really refreshing and they also have wifi which is a plus!

Second time here. This review is pretty much based on the service I received. I'm happy to have gotten the server/cashier that I had when ordering my food this time. (Tuesday,8-22-17, approx. 7:15 in the evening). I informed her I was a vegetarian, and she said she was actually vegan, and she could help me with ordering my burrito. I told the last girl when I was there that I was a strict vegetarian (and no fish or seafood) and she didn't bother to tell me that the sauce I ordered contained fish eggs. (Found that out tonight when this lovely young lady informed me). She was patient with me, and even let me know that some items were fried in the same oil/vat as the shrimp tempura, etc. She made sure my burrito was full to my liking (since basically everything in it was vegetables) and was super friendly. I don't know why I never think to get people's names when I'm complimenting them until after I've left, and this case is no exception. Wish I'd have gotten her name in case a manager or owner reads this review.

Las Vegas poke scene has expanded rapidly and there are so many (too many) options to choose from. What attracted me to this place was the fact that Poke Poku is a "Hawaiian" poke bar but I'm a little confused because nothing was really Hawaiian about this place. I don't think they got da kine here, da Hawaiian kine. 

What do I expect from a place that calls themselves "Hawaiian"? I'm looking for friendly aloha vibes. Broke da mouth grindz.

Instead what I got was not so welcoming service, expensive/small portion and subpar food. Yes, I know poke is not the cheapest lunch. But compare to other poke options in town, this was the least amount of food I got for the price I paid. 

I did enjoy the different sauce combinations they offered, as well as their unlimited topping options. I ordered their poke bowl with salmon and various toppings, then chose poke poku sauce to go with it. Sauce was good, and not overpowering as I expected it to be. Overall it was pretty average.

I must say as a tea enthusiast, their complimentary tea bar was the highlight of my visit. They have 3 different tea options and all teas are nice and refreshing.

For Hawaiian poke bar and true ono grindz, I prefer Paina cafe over this one.

Wow! We were looking for Poke for my fiancé's birthday for a quick bite and I saw this place had 5 stars, it was totally out of our way, but we decided to check it out. We were so thankful we did because we loved this place! Super cute decor upon walking to the entrance and inside. The poke was super fresh and had many options. My favorite part was that my salmon pieces were CHUNKS. They were huge! The servers were nice and friendly, answering our questions and helping us decide on stuff. We also got the takoyaki which was yummmy!
A huge bonus for us was the Bible verse written on the place mat. 
If we lived closer, we would go all the time, but we will definitely still go out of our way for this =)
Ive had better poke places BUT This place is still delicious!. They give free miso soup if you dine in .

Such a good poke bowl/burrito place!!! The serving size is huge, and the ingredients taste so fresh. My customer service was great as well. Monday's through Friday, 11am-4pm, poke bowls, burritos are $5. This place is a little hidden, when you see cheeburger, this place is in the complex behind.

The food was delicious at a reasonable price!  Service was fantastic and loved the complimentary tea drinks. They also had plethora of unique Asian drinks as well for purchase.  
Not that we needed it but they have free wifi. 
I think my favorite sauce was Korean chili sauce but all the sauce option sounded great.
Highly recommend and would definitely come back!
Two words AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS!!! I love this place, it is a must every time we visit Las Vegas.

Being from Hawaii, I constantly crave poke and I am very critical of the tradition of it. When "poke" started to pop up all over Las Vegas I was extremely disappointed to find places were calling  a sushi bowl poke. Cubed fish is not poke... let's make that clear. However, Poke Poku is an exception to the fad.

I recently moved to the complex next to it and my favorite poke place is now a twenty minute drive away so I decided to give it a try. We were not disappointed! I've already been five times. 

It is ordering made easy! Everything is up on the board for you to choose step by step. He portions are also generous. They have sizes s-xl. I went with the Medium which is 3 scoops of fish along with your sides but it was too much so started ordering the small which is perfect for me. I love that they have a variety of sauce mixtures put together for you to choose from to add to your fish(this is what makes it poke). I mix all of my add ins together so it makes he poke even better! I LOVE this place and if you're on the south west side of town, you should definitely give it a try. The staff is also normally very friendly with the exception of one girl who wasn't very happy the other day ? my only gripe is that I would like the fish to be cut a little smaller. Just because it's easier to eat that way! 

Food: 5/5
Staff: 4/5
Cleanliness: 5/5
Price: $

My wife and I decided to conquer all of the Poke bowl places on our end of town. Finally found one that has some of the freshest ingredients and are super nice. We have been here twice and each time one of the owners was serving us. They really take pride in providing you with the best Poke bowl and experience. I get the half ahi and half fried soft shell  crab. Awe man talk about some of the best flavors ever. Also throw the gangsta sauce all of that bowl and you will thank me. Don't forget to add fresh jalapeño also. Love this place and it blows all of the others out of the water.

I have been waiting to try this place out since hearing some good reviews from friends. Finally decided to go and saw that it was on Yelp Eat24 so I placed an online order for pick up. I ordered a Poke Burrito and a Poke Bowl. Went in a little early to see if it happened to be ready and was told they "forgot" the order. Waited some more and then was told they ran out of spicy tuna. Opted for the tuna and waited again and finally it was ready. Since it wasn't busy inside decided to dine in. Opened bowl and saw no sauce. Took first bite and tasted no sauce although they said it was on there. Waited again to get a side of sauce. After all that the bowl was very good. The burrito was too. Then I get to the mochi ice cream and it was hard as a rock and you could see the icicles on top. Asked if they could defrost it and they said they would. Then they come back to say all their mochi is like that and offered to give a macaron ice cream sandwich in place of the mochi. That was very nice of them. Despite the mishaps during my very first visit here, I will be coming back because the food was delicious and I hope to have a much better experience.

I still have a few more local places to try, including a vaunted Hawaiian import (which is a bit like comparing apples to pears, but that's another story), but I'll just come out and say it: best poke bowl place I've tried so far.

Poke Poku is one of many similar restaurants on Rainbow Blvd that's trying to ride the latest fad. They're deep within a plaza next to Goodwill, and they're conveniently across the side street from beloved bubble tea shop Brew Tea Bar.

Poke Poku does bill itself as a "Hawaiian" poke restaurant, but it's still fashioned in the style of most poke bowl places in that you're assembling the product step-by-step a la Chipotle (but with seafood and typical ingredients):

"Start Here" - there are more options now than they had when I peeked in during their first week. You can choose from a poke bowl/salad, "Hawaiian Poke" (served without rice/greens), or sushi burrito (one size fits all). I went with a large poke bowl ($13.50 for 4 scoops of protein). There are also numerous appetizers available, but those only need to be ordered at the register.

Step 1 ("Base") - white rice, brown rice, mixed salad, baby kale, or a half and half mix of any of those. I stuck with the white rice.

The employee asked at this point if I wanted furikake, and I said yes. Why not have good seasoning, right?

Step 2 ("Sides") - pick two of the seaweed salad, edamame, crab meat, spicy crab meat, avocado, or fried shrimp tempura. I went for seaweed salad and shrimp tempura, and both were actually about as good as you'd expect. Extra sides available for $1.50

Step 3 ("Protein") - went with tuna, yellowtail, seared albacore, and salmon (after being informed that snapper was unavailable). Also available are bay scallop ,spicy tuna, soft shell crab, diced shrimp, and octopus, with extra proteins worth $1.75 each... hmm, maybe I should've tried to game them by doing a small bowl with two extra proteins?

"Sauce" (not an actual step): select from predesigned mixtures of sauces, or perhaps create your own out of what appeared to be a dozen different sauces. I went with the namesake Poke Poku Style, which was sesame oil, spicy mayo, spicy chili, sriracha, and something called Aloha sauce (note from a Hawaiian co-worker: if this is the shoyu brand, then the sauce has two key components of traditional poke). The end result did not taste too spicy, so don't worry about those labels unless you're ultra-sensitive.

Step 4 ("Mix-ins"): I went with masago, tomato, cilantro, mango, red onion. Other options include cucumber, lettuce, pineapple, and organic tofu. After this step, the employee will mix by hand the items from steps 3 through 4 (including sauce), so all of these get coated in sauces before being transferred to your actual bowl.

Step 5 ("Toppings"): I can see why some of these are separate, but I wouldn't have minded others being mixed evenly. I picked green onion, roasted garlic, tamago, kizami nori (shredded seaweed; note that they add a whole piece of nori to the bowl at the end anyway), corn, and tobiko. I probably should've added shredded bonito, and other toppings included jalapeno, crispy onion, sea salt, and ginger.

Then it's cash register time, where they'll place your bowl on a tray. They also offered a small complimentary miso soup, which was actually pretty delicious and not too salty, and pointed out some free drinks on the side including something slightly bitter made from burdock root, a so-called jasmine tea that was really just weak tea, and a roasted corn drink that somewhat resembles barley tea and which I easily chose after quickly taste-testing them all.

My poke bowl was just thoroughly delicious for whatever combination of reasons. Seasonings and sauces were certainly key, but all of the fish were fresh (albeit not necessarily high-quality) and weren't cut too finely as I've had at other places. The white rice isn't sushi rice, but it certainly was cooked properly. All of the assorted add-ons can be tasted individually and were also fresh.

My friend and I also tried the takoyaki ($3.99) out of curiosity. While it's advertised as 6 pieces, it's more like 8 half-pieces, and it oddly appeared to have been cooked after being sliced. They were crunchy and I found my tako reasonably tender, although the texture of the filling was a little overcooked compared to what I've eaten elsewhere.

Poke Poku is a little pricey, but their main product is the best I've had in its genre. I've been trying to evaluate this form of restaurant on its own merits, rather than directly compared to sushi or traditional poke, and I've found none better. I should also disclaim that I've only just started trying to trick out poke bowls fully to my liking, but this was superior to two places where I've fully customized my bowls.

P.S. I'm eagerly awaiting the opportunity to try their food again closer to Henderson. They're aiming for a Feb. 2016 opening on Eastern Avenue in the EOS Fitness / Monta Chaya plaza.

THEIR POKE ARE SUPER DELICIOUS!! I was shopping at Goodwills and decide to give this place a try! And that was the best decision I've made! I got the medium bowl, their seafood are fresh and cut into a decent size( not too small)! Overall it's just really tasty! I'd for sure come back again and try other menu items! And don't forget to check in on Facebook to revive 10% off!!

Honestly I would rate it a negative 10 if I could . The workers were so rude with their service . The girl employee asked, if I wanted miso soup i asked my friend if she wanted some . My friend was about to answer if she wanted it , the girl employee said rudly and loudly "do you want it or not" and rolled her eyes . 
I was very shocked and disgusted .
And the toppings and mix - ins are very limited and they dont have a lot of options .
 The prices are okay , if u really want good service and amazing poke GO TO Ted's burrito!!!!
Never ever coming here again ! /:
This place gives you lots of delicious options. The miso soup is included in your meal. Unlimited tea. I'll definitely be back!
Work view - lunch is so good! If you haven't been to pok'e pok'u go check it out! $5 lunch special - sushi burrito/shu Mai/ drink/ miso!

I'm not sure where to begin! If you're driving through Vegas you HAVE to stop here! I am so impressed with everything about this place, especially the food. Obviously! I got a salad to go, huge portion, and began my way down the steps. You get two sides, and guess what? One of them is crab! Well both if you want! I mixed spicy with regular. Then we move to the beautiful pinkish, red, glorious, AHI tuna that caught my eye the moment we walked inside. Paired with fresh mix ins. I got the poke poku sauce, light siracha of course! The girl (pink hair) mixed the sauce flawlessly making sure the AHI was completely covered. We moved into the additions and I went to town, I recommend the garlic. This is a must! I have never seen this in poke, this is what made the entire bowl stand out. 

Everything about this bowl was fresh, and eloquently flavorful! This place has set my standards very high for the next poke place we eat at! Happy but sad! The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. They even came out to see how we liked it! Awesome!!! 

I would highly recommend this restaurant again. I will be coming back next time in in Vegas! Fantastic!!!

If you're looking for poke bowls and have a hard time choosing (considering they're popping up on every corner now) this place trumps them all! 

Just stopped in for the first time last night! I'm beyond impressed! Beautifully designed, extremely personable and helpful staff, lots of specials.

Their approach to creating poke bowls are unique and stand out in comparison to the typical build your own poke bowls/sushi burritos all over town (you'll have to just head over and see for yourself what I'm talking about). Their portions are huge (ordered a medium and barely made a dent in mine), quality of food is great (their brown rice was cooked to perfection which surprisingly a lot of people get wrong and their sauces actually had great flavor! I find a lot of places sauces to be super bland), got a free miso soup for dining in (which was so yummy), and they even have freshly brewed herbal iced teas COMPLIMENTARY that are so amazing!! I had the jasmine tea.

Unfortunately they're located in a somewhat out of sight view and not so noticeable if you were to pass by. Hoping the word of mouth with bring this great place some business!

Thanks to the staff for making our first visit so great! We'll definitely be back!

This area is well saturated with Poke/Sushi Burrito restaurants and by far this is the BEST of them all. Ambiance has a nice vibe and $5 sushi burrito lunch special is such a great value for what you get. Their portions of topping are just right and the sauces are flavorful. It was our first time here, definitely coming back and highly recommended :)

I love poke poku! The inside is super cute and the poke bowls are amazing! I like that they have so many different sizes for the bowls. The price is similar to most poke places! If you enjoy eating poke I would def give this place a try
The chick that gets transferred around is cool. Awesome poke salads too. And their Lunch special is ridiculous! $7 poke salad what whatttt. How could you go anywhere else ??!

They play K-POP, can't go wrong! No seriously...

What did I get
I got a small salad with 2 proteins and got the yellowtail and the salmon. I chose to have mine tossed with no sauce, cause I don't like my fish to be saucy, then topped it off with some random stuff. Got soy sauce on the side. IT WAS GREAT! They were big portions! And I was stuffed! There are a lot of toppings to chose from to be tossed with the fishes and then top your bowl off.

Environment
The restaurant was on a strip plaza. Easy to find. There is a ice cream place next door, great way to end the meal! If its your first time, you may need to take your time to read the menu, but it is very simple. There is specialty sauces they have that they will toss with your fish, but you are always welcome to mix your own stuff together! Your choice! There is teas to the side that are free! Barley, Jasmine and regular.

Niceness of Staff
She was really really nice. It was my first time there and she took the time to explain things to me. I decided to do the bowl but because I wanted vegetables, she recommended I do the salad plate so it holds more! Yay! Thanks for the help!

Dollar $
I would consider this very inexpensive and tasty. Especially for fish, it is hard to get good quality for a reasonable price. I am definitely happy with the meal!

Yes?
Absolutely! I would definitely go here again. Especially if I am trying not to eat rice, these are the salads I rather have! 

#WendyTakesVegas #WendyWanders

So many Poke joints within 2 mile radius. Competition was hot and not all were winning. Poke Poku won Monkey over easily, while others have disappeared. 

I think it's all about the choices and amounts of fish.  Monkey usual was a Medium bowl(3 proteins) with half brown rice half salad, soft shell crab, double Salmon, Korean sauce and all the fixins. Now sans the rice, a Medium Salad is a huge box of greens plus all the above. 

Friends who have tried other Poke joints and disliked Poke overall because of them, changed their tunes here. You're welcome. This my go to spot for Poke. I don't want it anywhere else. Poke Poku nailed down the value in its pricing, punch card and free delicious teas while dining in. Staff is always friendly, patient and kind. Great environment. 

Monkey do often.
Outstanding! A bowl of flavors with each amazing on its own. Definitely the best fast food I have had in a very long time. Best advice, just go.

My favorite poke place in Las Vegas. This place has amazing unlimited toppings, reasonable prices, top notch service, delicious seafood, and free miso soup + tea for dine-in. Small bowls will run you around $9 and the large (too much for me to finish) approximately $14. If you're a first-timer, go medium sized, half and half (tuna/salmon), and go from there. The sauces we tried: Japanese and Hawaiian (a little bit spicy). 

They've got the largest varieties of toppings of all the poke places I've visited and a loyalty program that rewards you after 10 or so purchases. Highly recommended.

I loved everything about this place. My new favorite poke spot. The decorations inside was adorable and perfect for the place. It was bright and happy inside. Everything was clean and their restroom even has a bench in it which I took a picture and it smell clean and bathroom was clean. I even took pictures of it :-) You get complimentary tea and miso soup if you dine here. Of course I chose to dine here. I usually get food to go but this place made me want to eat here. They have outdoor seating but it was 110 degree outside when I went on Father's Day. This father brought his two daughters here and they sat at the little kids table which was the cutest thing ever. Servers were really nice here. The toppings here was fresh and plentiful. I loved the variety of choices. I got the small poke bowl with half rice and half salad. I loved that they give you this option cause I wanted the two options. They give you two sides, two proteins choices (freaking awesome because most places only give you one protein choice and then charge you crazy for other protein) and you get unlimited toppings and mix in choices. They don't charge you extra for masago or other toppings choices. I love this place! So lucky I stopped in here. I highly recommend this place.

P.S. bonus points for them because on their sheet tray it says "I love you, lord, my strength psalm 18-1" I just got done attending church and stopped here to eat right after church! If I could give this place 6 stars I would. The owner did an amazing job at this place!
I really enjoyed this place.  I love the option of building your own bowl. I did scallop and octopus and it was so good.  I will definitely go back.

One of our new favorite restaurants in town! Cheap.. quick.. and oh so very tasty! We are just glad that we live so close to it so we can pop there for a quick lunch . Much fresher fish than the other places nearby .

Would have given a 5 star but I felt attitude problem from one of the clerks working & heard her slamming things.  If you're not having a great day, don't take it out on your customers.  Other than that food is delicious.  Would go back, but maybe to another location.

Wait. Hawaiian?? I thought it was Japanese. Oh well. It is terrific whatever it is. Delicious every time - this is about my 6th visit. Poke Poku is consistently good and fresh, food items are always stocked and the complimentary miso and tea are a nice touch (hey people don't complain about price until you look at the whole pic here!) Only one complaint: would much prefer freshly sliced avocado over mushed. Maybe that's just me though bc I have the same complaint at Subway, as I LOVE me some fresh avocado - the yummy superfood!

You can't go wrong w the Poke Poku sauce or the LV Style sauce.

The girls working today - Sun afternoon - are both polite, efficient and hard working. (Asian girl w long braids and blonde w med length pony tail/forearm tat).

Don't be intimidated first trip if you have never been to Poke Poku, just let them know and they hopefully will walk you through the steps to building a bowl or a burrito - and if you're lucky you won't get the impatient guy I had the first time YEEESH.

Try the Coffee Macaron Ice Cream sandwich if you didn't fill up on a huge bowl. Mmmm!
My new favorite place. Got a large bowl, but I didn't realize it was so much food. Lots of options. Healthy and super tasty. I felt like I was eating sushi in a bowl. No pictures,  I ate to fast.

Stellar customer service! I never have a bad experience when I go. 

I recently saw the "coming soon" poke cupcakes and knew that I HAD to have it for my husband's birthday. I messaged them about it and they were willing to put in a special order for me. The flavors were fantastic!
I love this place!!! Tried it for the first time and it's good I wish there was one in Chicago!!!

Best poke in Las Vegas! Definitely miss good poke being originally from OC.  I really like how they have a lot of options.  Out of all the poke places I've tried, this one stands out the most with Soft-Shell crab!  good stuff!  Service is really good, and they have complementary teas (Burdock, Jasmine, Corn, and Barley).  Sushi also tasted very fresh.  They also played Kpop/BTS!  Highly recommend and you won't be disappointed. ***Be sure to check-in on yelp for 10% discount!***

Came during lunch rush hour and they had one person working the counter. Was out of two main ingredients that you come there for. The food I did eat was tasty, but felt I was just settling. To much competition out there to be mediocre. And, we can't stand in line for 45 min when lunch break is an hour. Won't be back. The employee was as nice and good at what she does, washed her hands between ring ups and dishing and personable. Cared about what she was doing. She should find a better place to earn better tips.
Went to Poke Poku Bar yesterday and now I'm hooked!  Loved it!  Ordered a large poke bowl and found my new obsession!  Yummmmm

I come here often and it's usually 5 stars but this time it fell short. I got the medium bowl with all ahi tuna as always but this time I seen the gentlemen only scoop 2 scoop of protein. When I asked if he put 3 he said yes. When he passed on my bowl the lady was really nice but the gentleman kept taking the sauce she was about to use and mixing a small bowl. There was no one in line! Again when I was choosing my toppings he bumped his way over and started putting things in the mixing bowl so I waited again. Still no one in line.. When I got home I ate my bowl and I noticed that they shorted me. Now I'm thinking that he prolly ate my last scoop as a snack. When ordering beware and watch the amount of protein they put in your bowl.

This is my favorite poke place by far!! There are so many to choose from now and this one just seems to surpass all the others! Their fish is so fresh, they have such a great variety of toppings and mixins, and their sauces are just out of this world. I've tried their signature Poke Poku sauce, Hawaiian, and Japanese style and they're all just so delicious!

Craving a light but healthy and satisfying meal for dinner, I decided to give Poke Poku a try. Wow...fantastic!! The seafood proteins tasted fresh, the wide variety of toppings were great, and the food portions were very reasonable for the price! Patient friendly staff. Very clean establishment and energetic Asian techno pop music playing in the restaurant. I will definitely come back! Oh, and they also offer complimentary miso soup and fresh brewed teas.
Wow !! This is the best poke place I've been too. They hella pack your bowls and you definitely get your money's worth. Also they just started a HOT CHEETO BURRITO !!! I highly recommend.

CUSTOMER SERVICE IS GREAT!!! 

My friend and I came in the other night because we were craving salmon. I got a salmon poke bowl with yellow tail and shrimp tempura and crab meat. I am really indecisive in choosing toppings and sauces but the staff was so patient and personable, they really made my experience their great! 

The only thing they should do better is if they know they have a large crowd coming in for their lunch special, they should make more salmon to accommodate the customers. Other than that, I highly recommend this place.
Great selection of protein and toppings.. They give a lot of food for a reasonable price! Staff is also so nice and helpful.

Definitely not complaining about all the poke spots popping up all over the place. We've been enjoying Sweet Poké for a while but we decided to drive a little farther down the road to check out Poké Poku.

My girlfriend and I both got the "small" salad. America! The portion size was ample. The real difference in the sizes is how many scoops of seafood you get. Two is fine for us, especially since you get so much more along with it.

Cutting to the chase, this is another great poké option in the southwest area. I might ever so slightly favor this place over Sweet Poké thanks to having tobiko in the lineup. The employees were all friendly and helpful as we constructed our bowls. Actually, since we got salads, it's more like a plastic salad container, which I possibly prefer over Sweet Poké's bowls. (It seems like you do get a bowl if you get rice).

This place is pretty good. The staff was nice and hooked us up with a good amount of fish. My boyfriend and I were so full from the medium bowl but it was satisfying. The price is good for the amount of fish & extra toppings you can get. I also liked the fact that the spicy ahi was actually SPICY. I feel like its just missing something to really make it my go to poke spot since theirs three near me. Also I was a bit confused by the ambience of the place. Being from Hawaii I wanted to try this place because it says "Hawaiian Poke Bar" but its not like Hawaiian poke that you would find in Hawaii. All together this place is alright I think I was just expecting and wanting more from it.

I can honestly say this is the best poke bowl place I've ever tried. It was my first time here but I will be coming back. I had the most helpful girl with glasses and dyed blue hair tips help me! She was patient, answered my questions, and suggested items for me to try. She didn't make me feel stupid for wanting to know about the different sauces and options. Plus, you get so much for what you pay for! It's worth it!

This poke place is among many that opened on rainbow last year. It is in the same plaza as goodwill. I've been to this establishment twice and the second time was just as good as the first. 

Poke poku is similar to the other poke places in the way that it's a chipotle style way of ordering. I ordered a small bowl & that came with 2 scoops of protein. She pulled out the bowl & I thought to myself, "wow. That is so small. How am I supposed to get full off of that..." to my surprise, I could barely finish it. They really pack on the protein & the fix-ins! So the reason why I'm giving 4 stars is because of their shrimp tempura & soft-shell crab. I think it's great that the shrimp tempura isn't extra & you can just add it to your bowl, BUT when I tried it the first time I came here... it was horrible. It was cold & stale & not edible. I learned the second time I was here, but my friend got the soft shell crab & he made the same comments. I think they should really fix that. 

The service here though is A1!! Will come back but probs not for the fried stuff lol.

Came here with friends... 

Didn't order Poke but ordered the ramen and gyoza and it's taken around 15 minutes standing here. I get it that maybe they don't make it often but man don't order it if your are time crunched. 

Heard the poke is good though. Good customer service just slooooowwww ramen and gyoza.

Arg this place has been my favorite Poke Place in Vegas since I experienced my first bowl in California, but recently on my last visit my boyfriend and I had a bug (which I won't name what kind) crawl across the table we were eating at and gross me out. He killed it and we left. The place is always very clean and the front door opens and closes so much it could have easily came right through the front door. Unfortunately, I will have to try some other places for a while.

The food here is so good! The ingredients are fresh and I would totally recommend this to my friends. The service is also good and the food is worth the money. The atmosphere of the place is perfect for when you meet up with friends to eat poke.

A little far from Summerlin but worth the drive. Absolutely delicious- got the salad with salmon, hamachi, tuna with Hawaiian poke sauce with masago, spicy crab, seaweed salad , cucumber and radish =YUM! Generous portions and extremely fresh!

I've literally tried every poke spot and this is the best one that I've ever had. They STUFF your bowls so much it's great. I get a small and I'm full. They also have medium and large bowls as well. They even have sushi burritos as well! They also have
Fried calamari, shumai, and my favorite takoyaki. All the workers are super friendly. They also have complimentary green ice tea, corn water, and barley tea. Oh. And complimentary miso soup when you dine in. They also have lunch specials M-F where one of them you can get a sushi burrito and gyoza for $5. 

For the food...
Everything is so fresh! And it's soooo good. They also have so many different sauces that you can play with and mix to get which exact flavor sauce you want. This place is amazing! I'll be back :)

Poke Poku is a great little poke place. They have a lot of different options & a ton of unique sauces. This isn't my favorite spot for poke in town but I would go back, if I was on the Southwest side of town. The only issue I had with this location is the customer service. There were two young girls making my order & they seemed far too busy talking to each other about their personal lives than to actually give quality service to the patrons. Good food but they definitely would have gotten another star, if the service was better.

My go-to poke bowl spot in town. 

Ingredients are always fresh and service is great. 

A little bit on the pricey side but you will know where your extra pennies went. 

They are very generous with their servings and their takoyaki is one of the best. 

Highly recommend this place!

In love!  Our girlfriend suggested coming here for lunch.  We have been in Las Vegas for about 3 months and haven't tried sushi burrito yet.  We met up here around 1 PM, with 3 other friends.  The process was super easy.  We all got a sushi burrito with one protein, some gyoza, and tried their teas.  Everything was tasty and fresh.  The staff was super helpful and friendly.  Free wifi.  Clean.  Can't get any better.

The ingredients and toppings selection is great. Creative sauce choices. Generous portions. The complimentary soup and tea are a nice treat. The restaurant is clean and attractive. Overall a good place.

Ordered a large bowl, it was plenty of food! The portions here are perfect.... some poke bowl places over do the rice and then you have a lot of rice left over. 

The soft shell crab was amazing!! Best part of the bowl for sure! So many sides to choose from very pleased with the selection. 

Free miso soup if you dine in! And some out of this world miso soup at that!!!! 

We will be back for sure!
The poke was great, the service was great, the drinks slap, I don't really listen to kpop but they slap it & it slaps too lol. Overall great place 5/5

This place is amazing (and this is coming from someone who has tried 80% of the poke places in Vegas). I'm not even finished eating my poke but I felt so compelled to rave about it because it is very worth the praise that other yelp reviews have given it. They have 3 sizes (small, medium, and large) and as I have mentioned in a previous Yelp review, usually poke places only have regular and large sizes. The amount of toppings that you can get for no additional charge is huge! Including 5 different colors of masago, a super duper delicious soft shell crab mix, full cloves of roasted garlic, bonito flakes, etc. I also love that they are really generous with their portions...you will definitely be full even with a small! Additionally, they have complimentary health teas on the side which go well with the poke! 

Service is very friendly and helpful(they even gave me an extra topping choice for no reason), sauce choices are unique and delicious, and overall this place is just plain awesome. Do yourself a favor and stop by! I live quite far from here, but after trying this place, I will definitely be back because I think I found my new favorite poke restaurant!

Visiting my In-laws and ran into this place by accident when checking out an Ice Cream parlor next door.  Did not check reviews here on yelp but was hungry and wanting to try it out.   Wow!  By far the best Poke express bar I have been too.  I was blown away.  They weren't stingy on the Poke nor any other fresh fish that was available.  They had many topping options to choose from, and more additions to your bowl other than the places I have tried.  To top it off, they had free ice tea with 3 different flavors to choose from.  Definitely going to be my preferred stop for Poke next time I'm in Sin City.

Excellent food slow service 
Romi
Best Poke place on our side of town!! Always get the medium poke salad with basically everything! Generous on their fish too :D I go here almost every other week haha

Get the poke salad with 2 proteins, have the shrimp tempera and tuna, taste pretty fresh and lots of ingredients, portion is good for a small, for $9.50  it is a little high compare to Soho, but quality wise it is good.

Not only do they have an amazing selection of toppings, seafood and sauces the staff is always extremely friendly and remember me every time I come in! Good food plus good customer service. I'm a loyal customer and will continue to be one! I haven't had one bowl that was the same because there so many options and they always recommend different combinations of sauces to mix it up!! They have a loyalty card in case you become a fan like me. (Don't forget to try the roasted corn water- it sounded weird to me but I love it and won't leave without a sample)

Store associate just assisted other customers who decided to cut in front of me. Also assumed that myself and another individual were only making a single order, didn't ask if that was the full order. Next time pay attention to the order of your customers.

Poke poku has great quality fish. It's fresh and cut in larger pieces so it's similar to Hawaiian poke. It's a poke bar so you can pick and chose what you want in your bowl or burrito. They give you options of white or brown rice or salad and you can top it with anything you want. 

For my burrito I got it with salmon and yellowtail and tossed it in the poke poku sauce. It's their signature sauce but they have a bunch of different options as well. I topped mine with cucumbers spicy crab, avocado, corn and Masago. The flavors were spot on.  They also put fried garlic and furikake on top of the rice so it adds great flavor and texture. 

I can't wait to go back and try the bowls!

Excellent food!  The service took a while but it's because the line was so long!  Yes, it is that good! They also have a complimentary drink station that serves different teas!  I was full after a small bowl serving since they do give you plenty of fish and tamago egg is part of the free add ons. Def, will be going back when I am on that side of town!

A Californian visiting. Oh boy, what a great find. This little gem has great service and super fresh fish. The imitation crab is different than most places - less sweet and more fishy and it works great.

I can even suffer the k-pop for this great food.

I have been here twice and both times they were very good and tasted very fresh. They have different size bowls so you don't have to worry about getting too much or too little depending on how hungry you are at the time. The prices are good too for what you get. 

They have a lot of choices on sauces, toppings and mix-ins so variety is not a problem each visit.
Poke bowls are one of my top favorite food to eat.  Look no further this one it the place. I live 20 mins away. If this place was 5 mins away I will eat this every day.

This place offers poke bowl, takoyaki (octopus balls), dumpling and more. They are very generous with their ingredients. Even a small bowl is enough for me. Free complementary tea and miso soup if you dine in!

If this is Hawaiian Poke, I'm a Russian Princess.  But I'm getting ahead of myself.

Rant: pineapple, mango, corn, siracha, ponzu, eel sauce.  No, no, no, no, no, no!  We don't put these things in our poke in Hawaii!!!  Stop calling it Hawaiian poke!  Don't even get me started on putting pineapples on pizza.  Grrrrr.

That said, what is offered is very good "SoCal style" poke bowls and wraps.

Keeping it real, the seafood is previously frozen but not gassed or treated with color additives.  All good, the norm.  Crab is imitation, AKA krab.  Rice is of average quality, Best when served warm. Veg is fresh. Finally sauces, bold, all with a nice sesame oil flavor, those containing ponzu, have good acidity making them refreshing.

Tip: pass on poke only.  Poor value at $22/lb.

Ordering is, well you know the drill. As a bowl or burrito (the bowl is better as the burrito is so stuffed it oozes out and falls apart).  Mix and match up to three proteins to satiate your hunger. It's your creation.

Unlimited toppings a plus.  Servings are generous.  Free miso soup (dine in only).  Look for check-in offers (10% off with yelp or Facebook check-in's as of this writing).

Extremely friendly and patient off strip service.  Novices need not to stress.

Solid and an A=OK place to grab a bowl.

Mango poke, sheesh...
Good place to go for a poke bowl. Fish taste fresh and they are generous on their portions. I also like that they give complimentary miso and tea
Generous portions, great service, and huge selection of fresh fish.  I was surprised they had yellow tail!

I ABSOLUTELY LOVE my poke bowl from here! I'm usually so picky about pokebowls its ridiculous, but this place met my expectation and BEYOND! They literally pack the bowl to the top and they aren't skimpy with your bowls at all unlike other places!! They have fresh ahi tuna which is amazing and i appreciate how they tossed the tuna in sauces before adding them into the bowls! You get a lot of protein in the medium bowl and the toppings is AMAZING. This place is my all time favorite place to go for all my poke needs. The drive is a bit far from my house but it's so worth it. They have a big bar and you can pick and choose what you want in your bowls. Typically i get half and half but i got a full rice bowl here. This is my fave hawaiian poke joint!! They also have so many amazing toppings that other places don't offer as well. The place is fairly big and is always clean! They have a kid area and a drinking station while you wait as well! There's also a princess parking sign outside which is adorable!

Best place to get poke by far! For the price you get bigger portions than other poke places. The staff was friendly and patient in guiding you! I'm always indecisive. The veggies and fish are very fresh!! Plus complimentary iced teas! Awesome idea

Been coming here for a while and my experience sucked this time around. Service was slow - it felt like the girl had attitude with me. And seemed like they were too lazy. Tuna was one of my protein choices. The girl gave me an undersized scoop. I know it was because she looked in the container for more but didn't see any and just shrugged her shoulders and moved along. I had asked if I could get a bit and she said I had gotten a full scoop. If I had, there would have been no reason for her to check if there was anymore. Smh Worse experience I've had.
Very good experience.  Lots of toppings.  Helpful staff.  Menu is fairly easy to read.  The space inside is a little clunky.  I enjoyed it overall.  Will return.

We went there this past Friday and I had the lunch combo two, which happened to be a salad.  I literally had the very nice associate pick and choose for me.  Great service and super good portions.

Get the stamp card and you'll notice a little gift.....a Bible scripture! 

Not only do you get a great meal for a good price, but then you get a refreshing reminder to bring you through your day.

No doubt this place is five stars..

One of the best gems in Las Vegas.  Tasty and fresh food, great service, large portions, clean and very reasonably priced. Highly recommend to all.  They currently also have a special where done in customers receive free bowl of miso soup as well as unlimited ice tea.  The dumplings are a must try as well.
My bowl is awesome. Fish is fresh. Gyoza was yummy. Place clean. Employees are helpful with suggestions. I will be back!

I love the layout/energy of this place. I was really impressed with the FREE complimentary teas and FREE cup of miso soup. The large bowl is a good portion, typical price range for a large bowl and comes with mango/pineapple which is a must to fulfill my poke cravings. Overall, a great place to stop by if you're in Las Vegas.
Ordered delivery and it said one hour but it was delivered in 30 minutes and tasted fantastic. Would reorder again soon.

Finally got to try this place after having it bookmarked for months. Came in today for their $5 sushi burrito special. It should have included 1 scoop protein, Mochi ice cream, healthy waters and miso soup if you dined in. Even at 7pm, place was packed. Line took longer due to the cashier serving food. The burrito itself is small compared to other places but not bad for $5. I'm the burrito itself was delicious. Fish was fresh and it had great flavor. They failed to give us the mochi ice cream and honestly we forgot to ask for it. 

Overall, place was nice, clean and busy. I would definitely recommend this place and we would definitely come back.

This place is the beet Poke place on the west side of the valley. I would eat it every day if I could.  The ingredients are all fresh, the staff are all friendly, and the price is just right. They charge around 12$ for a medium bowl which includes 3 scoops of protein and unlimited toppings. They also have so many different combinations of sauces that make the poke even more flavorful. I make my own sauce as a combination of a few of their sauces and it taste so delicious. I've tried both the tuna and salmon and both are great. They also make a pretty stellar spicy tuna option as well.  The sides that are my favorite are the seaweed salad and the shrimp tempura. 

I would have given 5 stars but I am not a fan of the new Miso recipe at all. It has a lot of gunk at the bottom of the cup which isn't tasty at all. 

One tip: go to Smiths and buy something before you go. They offer a 25% off coupon on the back of any Smith's receipt.
Probably the best pokebar in whole Vegas area. Recently got really in to pokes and never seen a place like here fresh. Most likely the top far as now in town...

This will definitely be my new addiction.  I'm from the islands and I luv my Poke. I ordered a medium poke salad and it came with free miso soup if you dine in,  I could only eat half of my salad and I was full.  I like that the menu has steps to build ur bowl or salad and the employees are more than willing to walk you through the build.  Over all I will be back.  Ono!
Best poke in town! The fish is super fresh and you definitely get what you pay for. I've tried poke places all over town, but nothing compares to this one. 5 stars for sure!

Poke Poku was decent. If you dine in, you get a complimentary miso soup and there is also complimentary iced teas on the side counter. 

The only downside I would say is their "spicy tuna" is some sort of a mashed up tuna blend served with an ice cream scoop - not what I'm normally use to. 

If I come back, I'll make sure to only order the tuna, salmon and octopus as my 3 fish sides.

I love this place! It's always busy when I come in in the afternoon but tbh it's worth the wait! I love the free miso and the free teas they have. My friend that I always bring love it as well, it's a chill spot hangout with friends as well.

First off let me start off by saying how cute this place is . Inside is super clean and well decorated. The menu is pretty simple step by step . You have the option of a bowl , salad or burrito . The one thing that has shocked me is portions size and quality of the fish . Most places I've tried have nearly diced the tuna or have the crappy smashed up tuna wich I hate . I got a combination of rice spicy crab meat and a portions consisted of tuna, salmon, and octopus. (All scoops were actual scoop size) then my toppings were the usual green onions and nothing too exciting . The sauce i did decide on was there house sauce the Poké poku sauce and it was a spicy mayo ish sauce with a kick . It was delicious. My boyfriend got a salad with all the same toppings as me and the Hawaiian sauce wich was amazing also. This place by far has been my favorite find near me ! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone on the southwest area near rainbow and 215 . They also give you a free miso soup for dine in costumers . I love miso soup but most places miso suck . This place on the other hand really surprised ! The gyoza also was delicious !

Poke poku is not only healthy but delicious!! I usually come here for the salad lunch special which is $7. Their salmon is always fresh and I love all thE sides you can add on! Today they're having a special event where poke bowls are free from 4-5!! How awesome is that! If you dine in, you get free miso soup and free tea! I highly recommend poke poku!

Love the wide selection of choices that you can add to your bowl without the additional prices. To me, that totally makes up for it being pricier. The tempura shrimp topping is a winner for me!

I definitely love the lunch specials for their sushi burritos. It's something I look forward to before a long day of work. If you ever dine in, you also get free miso soup and a selection of free drinks. Albeit so, the drinks are not very great, but it's still a nice gesture for it being free.

I've been to many sushi burrito and poke bowl places, but from my experience, there's not many that come in comparison to this location here on Rainbow. The great quality and wide variety of choices just has Poke Poku coming ahead of the game.
The best I've had so far and they do give you a lot plus free miso and tea if dining in. Will definitely come back!  Very friendly staff also.
Been to a few poke places, but this one is the best so far! so good! & Very clean and cute little spot.  already craving some more.
so far the best poke place in las vegas!! would recommend to any poke lovers

If you love customizing your poke, love fresh ingredients and you're hungry (big servings!!) you'll love this place. I just moved to the area and have been going on a poke bowl rampage trying everything I can find.  So far this is my favorite.  Definitely try it out if like me you're obsessed with Poke bowls!

Don't hesitate to look further for other POKÉ places. Becuase this would be your first choice.

I've tried many different Poké spots that just recently open. But Poku had the most freshest fish and toppings to offer. I loved the setting of the dining area. I was greeted with a good impression from the girl with pink hair. Good job ! 

Not only this place is a little pricey but it beats other places Becuase they offer shrimp tempura on their sides. 
Most of the toppings were unlimited. Just a little downfall they didn't have white tuna but that's okay. I will be a regular here at Poku since their portion is huge.

Free miso soup when you dine in as well !!

I ordered delivery from Poke Poku, through Yelp Eat24. I've never been to the restaurant in person.

I love poke, when it's made fresh and to order. No grocery slop that may have been sitting, dressed, for up to two days, yuch. I've only ordered from this establishment once, and I've only ordered two things, but the bowl was so extraordinarily good that I had to comment.

What I had:
TAKOYAKI:
A bit disappointing, but not surprising, considering that most Asian establishments in this town don't do it right. I may be overly critical; not only did I learn to eat TAKOYAKI when I lived in Japan, I lived in Osaka, the takoyaki capital. So I didn't subtract any stars 

MEDIUM POKE BOWL:
I don't really need to note the particular ingredients I chose for my bowl, save to say that everything was fresh and flavorful. You build your bowl from the bottom up, according to your taste, and the options are numerous! The tuna, while not prime quality ahi, was decent and cut bite-sized enough to cover any inherent flaws, like sinews. If you ordered the same amount of maguro nigiri at a sushi restaurant, you'd probably pay $80 and not get anything but the sushi; this bowl was only $13 and was delicious and full of extra yummies. Small and large bowls are available, too, to suit the size of your appetite.

The restaurant also offers poke salads, in case rice isn't, well, your bowl of rice. And sushi burritos, too, whatever THEY are (yes, I'm a genuine sushi snob!). I didn't see misoshiru on the menu, perhaps my eyes just passed it by.

I may not review this establishment again, but I will certainly order from here, again and again!

Absolutely delicious.   I love all the poke places popping up all over town!!!   They all are pretty much the same.  Everything here was fresh,  restaurant was clean, and the help was very friendly.   So many choices I didn't know where to begin!!!   But the best was the lunch special sushi burrito,  $5 and they did not skimp on the sides and mix-ins.   Other places would charge $10 easily...   I will be back again and again...

I've been to a lot of poke places and this is one of the better ones. The fish taste fresh, the employees were courteous and the place was clean. What else can you ask for? Generous portions of course! I got a bowl and couldn't finish so I took it home for a second round for dinner. Yay! I LOVE spicy foods and their gangster sauce is right up there! Delish food, good service and ice cream. Done and done.

Easy to order, fast casual. Prices are reasonable and they have more than just poke, but appetizers and ramen for a great price too! Their portions are huge. I ordered an XS salad and had plenty leftover for lunch the next day.

Good poke place; it's another one of the chain, Chiptole style places, but their selection is a bit more than the others that I've seen. In particular, they had three different kinds of fish eggs to add in. Enjoyable stuff.
I didn't receive my complete order the chef decided to make some adjustments to my order I won't order from this place again

I like the quality of fish here. The sauce option is good. My only complaint is that when you order medium to large bowl there're lots of rice but the sauce they put on the fish for these sizes are not enough so bottom of the bowl will get no flavors
I love this place, it provides a massive amount of food even for when I order the smallest size container. Taste is always good across multiple visits.

Every time I eat here I'm always afraid my tongue is going to punch a hole in the roof of my mouth, give my brain a hug and throw a party! So eat here at your own risk! HEAVEN IN A BOWL!!!! The service is amazing, the tuna is out of this world and the large $13 bowl can feed two easy! 
I'm a dietary vegan and I eat fish a couple times a month, so have no fear if you are vegan they will set you up right!!! It is rare as a vegan that you go out to eat and find anything palatable. Oh my! Forget that noise! They pile it high give you extra yummy topping choices in place of your proteins and they have tofu!!!! YUMMY!!!!!! Now after writing this review I don't care that it's almost 8 at night I'm ordering in some Poke Poku!!! Woot Woot!!! I may have a mild addiction! 

(BTW if you're ordering in as a vegan call them and tell them what you want and they'll tell you what to do)

This is one of many, many poke places around this area (89113-89139 zip codes). By far this place is the best in my opinion. The seafood and produce are very fresh and the wide variety of sauces are tasty. In addition to the various foods, the restaurant offers complimentary teas which you just feel good drinking, ya know? I highly recommend to new and senior poke eaters.
Poke bowls are delicious and light but yet filling.The staff is always friendly, attentive and fast, so you're in and out in a minute or two! Perfect for a healthy lunch.
Delicious! So far my favorite poke spot on Rainbow. The food was very flavorful and filling! Free wifi and very clean!

We ordered 2 burritos and a salad.  Nothing was worth the 34 dollars we paid, the salad was literally one cup for 9.50 my burrito was crab, salmon, tuna I found 3 pieces of salmon 1 of tuna smashed and the rest was crab meat... the other burrito had no tuna just the crab meat it was missing a lot of the items we added... very disappointed!!!

I got a few missed call from my friend Leo. So I texted him asking "what's up?"  Turns out he wanted to know if I have had lunch already.

It was like 2pm, but I managed to miss lunch while studying for a TAM card exam, plus procrastinating on Facebook and also watched a few Tasty Japan videos. 

Apparently it is also Poke Poku's One Year Anniversary and they are offering complimentary appetizer sampler and dessert with your entree order all day this weekend (Oct 21 & 22).  Sounds good to me!  I love having foodie friends that help keep me in the loop for these promos.  And if you check-in on Facebook, you get 10% off your order.

Mochi Ice Cream Free - Green Tea or Red Bean (I suggest you eat this first, mine was melted by the time I finished my large poké salad)
3pcs of Goyza Free
3pcs of Shrimp Shumai Free
5pcs of Calamari Free
Miso Soup Free (Dine-in Only)
And Healthy Water- always on the house (3 varieties of iced brewed tea)

As far as Poké goes, it is NOT traditional Hawaiian style, in spite of the restaurant's name. Brah, if that is exactly what you're craving for, then you will be disappointed. Come on, even the Poké occasionally sold at select LV Costco locations are more authentic. No stink talk intended. Just laying some truth. I will also not say SoCal or Korean fusion version of Poké are not also grinds. (double negatives, so it is GRINDS!) Actually it is quite popular on the West Coast and made its way to Las Vegas.  In fact there seems to be a "Poké" bowl or sushi burrito eatery open on every block in this SW part of town.

While waiting for the 4 people ahead of me in line placing their orders, I distracted myself posting pictures to Instagram Story and snapping a few more pictures for Yelp and Facebook check-in.  Leo said I waited a long time, but I didn't really noticed.  And I also did not utilized my time more wisely studying the menu, so I ended up ordering a large salad and then haphazardly picked the other items (I don't want to be that guy taking forever with the order and pissing off the people patiently waiting behind me) to complete my order.

So ended up with the following mad creation:
(Step 1) Mixed Salad
(Step 2) Seaweed Salad + Fried Shrimp Tempura (pass on this next time)
(Step 3) Salmon + Scallop + Yellowtail + Seared Albacore
(Step 4) Everything (but they skipped on the Pineapple, Mango and Organic Tofu)
(Step 5) Everything, except Jalapeño + Sea Salt
And for someone that does not particularly like spicy food, I went with Gangster Style for the Sauce option (Sesame Oil + Spicy Chili + Sriracha + Spicy Chili +  Spicy Chili + Spicy Chili). Next time I will be sure to read the menu first than survey the premises with keepsake photos. 

Anyway, the portion is generous and although I paid $13.15 for a large salad (with the 10% FB check-in discount), I still felt it was a reasonable deal. Plus they gave me a fried appetizer sampler and Mochi Ice Cream to celebrate their One Year Anniversary. 

Today may be my first visit, but for sure it will not be the last.  I still have 9 more sauces to try.

So HAAAAPPPPY One Year ANNIVERSARY POKE POKU!!!
And best of luck in the opening of the next two locations in the Ninth Island.

I was craving poke but wasn't near home so i found this place on yelp so i figured I'd give it a try. It seemed like any other poke place so i ordered a 2 scoop bowl with rice, 2 scoops salmon, ny style sauce, crab meat and some toppings.  It was all put in a tiny bowl so i was a little disappointed. Once i ate it though..OMG! The flavor!! The freshness!! I was beyond pleased!! And the small bowl looked deceiving because there was plenty of food in there for my full meal. My only complaints....the crab was a little too creamy and the forks are super flimsy!! Yes, those are my only complaints! Delicious and will have it again when I'm in the area!!

Ok sorry my mistake on my tips section I ment to say was the one on rainbow gives less on their large order then the one in Henderson which I get a medium and it looks like an extra large. So I paid 2 dollars more for less food lol.. BTW the service in the Henderson location their customer service is so much better.
This place is super cute on the inside and one of the only places for takeout that offers corn tea! I have never tried poke before, after eating here I wondered why I haven't tried poke sooner!
Love this place!! Food is always fresh, great atmosphere and clean. A lot of items to choose from for your Bowl. They give you a lot for your money!!

Ok. Went in on a whim. Just great. Wife and I both ordered the large salad. So much sushi grade poke fish on top. Let him sauce it himself. They let you choose the toppings, but I wanted to trust their judgement. 

It did not disappoint. 

Top tip. Only order the large if you are HANGRY. Next time I'm getting a size smaller. 

I'm stuffed, but happy.

visiting from out of town and drove by poke poku! and glad we did! i love healthier & lighter options and they have plenty to choose from! the food was so good! i got a sushi burrito and a miso soup! will definitely come back again if we get the chance
